description.en-US: The Lib Tech T.Rice Pro HP C2 Snowboard was born and raised in Jackson Hole. If that doesn't mean anything to you, let us break it down: it's annoyingly good at everything, loves a good cliff or couloir, and it invades Moab in the off season. If it can handle Corbet's, it can definitely handle your neck of the woods, so level up your game with Travis Rice's baby.
name.en-US: Lib Tech T.Rice Pro HP C2

description.en-US: Double down on your porcine persuasion with the Ride Twinpig Snowboard. This freestyle machine is everything you love about the short, fat, directional Warpig, but in a twin shape that means you get all the pork going forward, plus all the pork going backwards. It slays in either direction and does extra damage in the park with a wide shape and double blunted nose for easy spinning and stomping.

Blast off into the shred-o-sphere with the CAPiTA Aeronaut Snowboard, an eye-popping cambered masterpiece thats's made for the all-mountain grind. Created with legend Arthur Longo, it features a progressive sidecut and medium flex for versatility that'll take you from side hits to the slackcountry. A lightweight and durable Hoover Core with Carbon Flax amplifiers add lightweight stability and tons of pop. The CAPiTA Aeronaut Snowboard is a jack of all trades, straight from the mothership.

The Season Nexus Snowboard stands out in the arms race of bloated quivers and technical jargon - a simple skeleton key capable of unlocking the innate potential of any day in the mountains. Its straightforward geometry cuts through the noise, creating something that adds up to much more than the sum of its parts. Ample float in powder, smooth, engaged turns on hardpack, and dependable performance in everyday resort chop. It’s the ultimate quiver of one - more than enough to remind you why you fell in love with snowboarding in the first place.

The Lib Tech T.Rice Orca Snowboard is still out there chomping fish. The volume-shifted pow ripper that'll have you laughing as you chop the tops off moguls, the Orca has become the pillar of do-it-all boards. The sidecut's tight enough to drill a spiral carve down to the bedrock, the short nose floats like a dang cork in the Dead Sea, and it stays stable at ludicrous speeds. From Jackson Hole to the BC BC, from Mt Baker to whatever that ice moon of Jupiter is called: the Orca's ready to eat.

The Rossignol Myth Snowboard and its reputation for making the transition from beginner to advanced a snap isn't just some old wive's tale, it's the hard cold truth. The combination of Auto Turn Rocker and a relatively soft flex mean getting up and running has never been simpler. Toss out those falsehoods about snowboarding being cold, hard and difficult to master: get on the Myth and get after it.

At this point, the Ride Warpig Snowboard is the stuff of legend. A card carrying member of the volume shifted revolution, the war-mongering hog sports a sturdy directional shape, a super wide platform, and a nimble dual-radius sidecut, delivering all mountain capability with a signature playful personality like few other boards can. The Warpig is one of the best all-arounders on the market, and it's high time you found out what all the fuss is about.

Sip it and rip it: the Lib Tech Cold Brew C2 Snowboard is pure frozen nitro go-go juice. An all-mountain ripper with a directional shape and powerful C2 rocker profile, this board is equally adept at quick shots down chutes, and thirsty-two ouncer long haul trucker runs. It does prefer fresh snow, but don't we all? Order up a triple double with cream on top: this one's the all day pick-me-up! Get low, stay powerful, remain caffeinated.

Indulge in the smooth and effortless ride of the K2 Dreamsicle Snowboard, an all-mountain board designed to take you from silky side hits to soft stashes with ease. Combining a setback stance, twin shape, and directional rocker profile, the Dreamsicle offers precise control and catch-free turns, allowing you to carve easily on hardpack and float effortlessly on powder days. And with a supple flex and women's-specific Rhythm Core, it's the perfect board for relaxed cruising in all conditions.

The CAPiTA Mega Mercury Snowboard takes the all-round versatility of the already popular Mercury and slathers it with extra sauce. Laid up with a super poppy core, this capable deck is amped up and slimmed down with Capita's Megacarbon™ Array and Megalite Skin™ for lightweight performance that allows you take flight in any situation. New for this season are freshly minted wide models and Capita's fastest Megadrive™ Base, found only on the Mega line-up.

The Season Aero Snowboard is a rocket ship, surgeon’s scalpel, and artist’s paintbrush rolled into one. It’s that friend you can rely on to drop everything to go ride - the same one who makes you feel ten feet tall when things get spicy. Crafted with traditional camber and a powerful flex, it exudes confidence in rugged terrain and purrs when you open up the throttle to paint fast, clean arcs through the chop. Top to bottom, bell to bell, the Aero is built to fly.

The GNU Asym Velvet C2 Snowboard is an all mountain twin with a twist. This smooth customer is designed to complement the body's natural asymmetry with a softer core and shorter radius on the heel-side for improved response and a velvety smooth feel that'll keep you hopping back on the lift for one more lap. Its a joy to carve down groomers, feels lively through the trees, and delivers tons of energy and pop for freestyle maneuvers all around the mountain.

The Ride Psychocandy Snowboard brings the all-mountain, volume-shifted excellence of the Warpig to a slightly narrower platform with more inclusive sizing for smaller riders who can't find the right fit with the OG Pig. It also has a slightly more tapered tip and tail shape for easier pivoting in powder and even more playful riding through slush and groomers. It's a total blast to ride in any conditions, and a great choice for riders at all ability levels.

If you're going to add one Burton board to the quiver, it's gotta be the Burton Custom Flying V Snowboard. In fact, you may as well donate the rest of that quiver to your firewood pile, because the Custom will slot in for just about any day of the season. The combination of playful Flying V rocker with a directional twin shape and a setback stance is straight out of the snowboarding hall of fame, a tried and true recipe for all mountain prowess. Add a lightweight wood core backed up by chatter damping carbon highlights, and the Custom is calm, collected, and capable in all conditions – a slam dunk for your daily driver.

Freeride to freestyle, the Lib Tech Terrain Wrecker C2X Snowboard will stomp in any terrain and devastate the haters. Hybrid C2X features powerful camber underfoot for pop and stability at wind-burning speeds and the floaty nose lets you continue charging when the snow is deep and the consequences are low. Think beyond the park and leave a commotion in your wake.

Slither down the mountain on the Rossignol Soulside Snowboard, a skill building board that's just as forgiving as it is fun. Rocker and a soft flex provide a maneuverable platform that lets you experiment with new terrain and explore the mountain with ease. Jump into it on the Rossignol Soulside Snowboard.

The Ride Algorhythm Snowboard is a snowboarders' snowboard. Like the sport itself, from the parks it came and to the parks it shall return. But in between, it does a whole lot more. This directional twin is high performing yet approachable, blending the playful elegance of a freestyle jib stick with the casual competence of a sturdy all-mountain board. Utilizing a quadratic sidecut for easy and precise turning, plus a whole bunch of carbon fiber for dialed pop and response, the Algorhythm is an easy choice for anytime styling on any terrain.

A banana may only be $10 but Lib Tech's Banana Tech is priceless. Whether you're on day 1 or day 500, the mild camber underfoot is stable and confidence-inspiring and central rocker gives you float on epic blower days. Magne-Traction provides extra bite on variable terrain, icy groomers, and anywhere else your riding takes you. This banana rips!

The Rossignol Myth LTD Snowboard and its reputation for making the transition from beginner to advanced a snap isn't just some old wive's tale, it's the hard cold truth. The combination of Auto Turn Rocker and a relatively soft flex mean getting up and running has never been simpler. Toss out those falsehoods about snowboarding being cold, hard and difficult to master: get on the Myth and get after it. Featuring a limited edition graphic – only available at evo – this is one Myth you can believe.

The Rossignol Evader Snowboard is the perfect platform to take your skills to the next level. A forgiving all-mountain board with AutoTurn rocker and a soft flex at a price point that's hard to argue with, the Evader Snowboard is poised to take you into new terrain and handle virtually any snow conditions.

The GNU Riders Choice Asym C2X Snowboard breaks out all the stops, incorporating all of the highest end materials and signature tech that GNU is known for. It uses an asymmetrical design for intuitive turning, Magne-Traction edges for insane grip, and finishes this off with Carbon Power bands for a little extra oomph when you have to lay the hammer down. The latest model has been updated with all new 3-D Delightwood Asym Chip construction, which transmits more energy to your edges for better than ever power, precision, and pop. It's time to hop on the Riders Choice and see what all the fuss is about.

The Burton Feelgood Flying V Snowboard provides the kind of warm-and-fuzzy feels that can only be achieved by spending epic days in the mountains. It's a classic all mountain shape steeped in Burton quality, pairing Burton's playful Flying V rocker profile with an energetic Super Fly II™ 700G Core and Carbon I-Beam reinforcement for smooth, chatter-free performance in all conditions. Make this your daily driver and turn that frown upside down.

Love the Warpig but need a little more pork in that sando? The Ride Superpig Snowboard is the hog you seek. Adding extra stiffness, camber, and space age tech to the proven Warpig design, the Superpig offers an upgraded ride for riders wallowing in the deepest, steepest stashes on the mountain.

Introducing the Roxy Raina Snowboard, the ultimate shred companion for snow royality. With a medium-soft flex, this board is your ticket to playful snowboarding bliss. Its directional twin geometry, Magne-Traction®, and C2 contour ensure you'll dominate any snow condition with comfort and precision. Whether you're a beginner ready to level up or an entry-level rider seeking a progression boost, the Roxy Raina Snowboard is your next go-to.

Tired of the same old options? The K2 Antidote Snowboard is the perfect cure. With a stiff and slightly setback design, it's perfect for hard-charging, down-the-line ripping. But don't let that fool you, this full cambered directional twin is also great in the park, providing exceptionally snappy performance along with a balanced feel in the air. Whether you're freestyling in pow, playing around on big mountain lines, or attacking the park, the Antidote delivers.

If everyone were as easygoing and downright amenable as the GNU B-Nice BTX Snowboard, the world would be a better place. This board has a soft, approachable flex and a progression friendly Original Banana rocker profile for catch free turns and instant float through softer snow. Effortless, intuitive, easy to ride, and easy to love, the B-Nice is the perfect resort BFF for riders growing in confidence day by day.

The Arbor Cadence Rocker LTD Snowboard is a versatile ripper for front side days lapping the park and carving corduroy with your pals. Featuring a mid-soft flex and system rocker, the Cadence is easy to turn and progress on and can really rip when you're ready to let loose. Limited edition evo x Arbor topsheet art and strong, eco friendly materials round out a stylish frontside package you can rep all season.

If your set-up trick is a lofted Cab 5, the Lib Tech EJack Knife HP C3 Snowboard is for you. The ultimate backcountry freestyle stick, this one's been stomping landings for a few years now, and it just keeps getting better. New for this model is a soft-serve spoon nose, do you can squeeze out a few more miles per hour on your way to that cheese wedge. Aggressive C3 camber, a super lightweight core, and a stiff flex only add to the eye-watering speeds you'll enjoy out there too: this board is ready to drop more hammers than a hardware store on a sinkhole.
name.en-US: Lib Tech EJack Knife HP C3

description.en-US: Calling all big dudes: the Lib Tech Skunk Ape II C2X Snowboard is the charging, all-mountain board that won't catch your heels and toes. The longer nose and wide to ultra-wide waist have the float you need on a pow day and the width you need to fit larger feet. Don't think you can only ride powder on this rig though, Magnetraction edges cut through ice and the C2X camber is made for all-mountain trenching.
name.en-US: Lib Tech Skunk Ape II C2X

description.en-US: An all-mountain ripper of a board with no bad habits, the Nidecker Venus SE Snowboard doesn't snore or leave its clothes lying in the hallway. All it does is handle all manner of snow and terrain with a lively, poppy personality that makes snowboarding fun day in and day out. Directional CamRock delivers the perfect mix of edgehold and surfiness, and a flex of "6" is a great compromise between "surfy" and "chargey". Decked out with a special edition evo topsheet, the Nidecker Venus SE Snowboard will turn heads on the slopes and lift line alike.

Kinetic energy just waiting to be unleashed, the Lib Tech Dynamo C3 Snowboard has the juice to get loose. With a stiffer flex mated to aggressive C3 camber, this one is definitely on the hard-charging end of the spectrum – look elsewhere if you're content to just kind of ride around, this board is hyper-focused and capable of some seriously supernova moves. Find this board under the feet of your local's hardest rippers, those riders who always seem to get to the zone first and when it's best. Join their ranks and hold on tight.

The CAPiTA Space Metal Fantasy Snowboard is an easy choice for the rider focused on improving their skills both in and out of the park. With its true twin, medium-flexing, rocker-flat-rocker construction, it's just plain hard to beat. Whether you're carving cord, working on your 360, or have your eyes set on secret pow stashes, the Space Metal Fantasy guarantees a good time.

After a couple years in worldwide lockdown, we're all experts at surviving indoors. Now that we're back outside, the CAPiTA Indoor Survival Snowboard is a perfect companion. This powerhouse of a twin is available in larger widths, ensuring that riders of all sizes can experience the Indoor Survival's superior performance. Equipped with cutting-edge features like the super-fast Quantum Drive base and the P2 Superlight Core™ with Titanal Centerline reinforcement, this snowboard is engineered to dominate the park and excel in all mountain conditions.

The GNU FB Head Space C3 Snowboard is Forest Bailey's tool for street sessions, park laps, and side hit shenanigans. The latest model drops in with a fresh outlook, ditching asym life for a more traditional pill-shaped twin shape. It's a throwback to the boards that made snowboarding great, and like those old school boards, the ingredients are simple but effective. There's a light and poppy G-Lite 2 wood core, C3 Camber for power and stability, and Magne-Traction edges for grip. If you're riding park and building features in your back yard every time it snows, this is the board for you.

If you're going to add one Burton board to the quiver, it's gotta be the Burton Custom Snowboard. In fact, you may as well donate the rest of that quiver to your firewood pile, because the Custom will slot in for just about any day of the season. The combination of traditional camber with a directional twin shape and a setback stance is straight out of the snowboarding hall of fame, a tried and true recipe for all mountain prowess. Add a lightweight wood core backed up by chatter damping carbon highlights, and the Custom is calm, collected, and capable in all conditions – a slam dunk for your daily driver.

The Ride Agenda Snowboard is an easygoing twin shape with a soft flex, dependable feel, and a playful personality. It's a winner for beginner to intermediate riders progressing in the park and beyond, and offers fantastic bang for your buck if you're stepping up from rentals. If you're looking for a board that will have you riding better and feeling more confident all over the mountain, this is the one for you.

The Arbor Ethos Rocker Snowboard is a women-specific board designed to help beginner and intermediate riders progress their skills. With a fully rockered profile and smooth, soft flex, this board offers easy turn initiation and catch-free riding. Whether you're building confidence on park features or learning to ride top-to-bottom from the summit chair, the The Arbor Ethos Rocker Snowboard inspires growth all around the mountain.

Sidehit hunters with that transition x-ray vision will love the new CAPiTA Mercury Snowboard. This weapon is happiest when carving through choppy snow, maintaining its stability and composure while laughing in the face of tracked-out terrain. It's perfect for seeking out hidden stashes of powder and creative cat track transfers, where it can charge harder and boost higher than seems prudent. Designed for riders who seek boost and roost, the CAPiTA Mercury Snowboard is a versatile option that can handle any challenge the mountain throws at it.

From the free-wheeling features of Natural Selection to the humble slopes of your local resort, the Lib Tech T.Rice Golden Orca Snowboard delivers the goods. Designed as a cross between the "regular" Orca and the ripping T.Rice Pro, this volume shifted hybrid is a little more centered, with a switch friendly tail profile. Just who's riding switch in pow? Well, you are! Takeoffs, landings, pow pillow blastings - everything is possible on this dream machine. Throw in a sick Joy Division inspired topsheet, and you've got a board that's less "unknown pleasures", and more "guaranteed fun".

When it comes time to celebrate your kiddo's shred-mitzvah - that is, the moment they come of age and hit the big jumps in the park - tradition dictates that you upgrade their beat up hand-me-down board to the CAPiTA Children Of The Gnar Snowboard. With features like next-generation hybrid camber, this high performance tween-age destroyer can go anywhere and do anything a young freestyler puts his mind to.

The CAPiTA Pathfinder Camber Snowboard illuminates the way for freestyle dreamers and resort riders who know what they want: light weight, durability, and tons of trusted tech for a reasonable financial outlay. This model features a low-rise camber profile with a user-friendly softer flex, taking the sting out of hardpack for intermediate riders (and keeping everything mellow for experienced rippers). With a predictable wood core, fast base, and tough construction, this is a workhorse of a playboard for jump jockeys and fun-focused riders.

Don't be deterred by its name - the CAPiTA Ultrafear Snowboard is actually quite chill once you get to know it. It may sound scary but it's designed to embrace that exhilarating rush of near-fear that makes life worth living and keeps you on your toes. This is a true twin freestyle stick with a medium flexing traditional camber profile that'll keep you upright on sketchy landings without delivering frozen butters. The Ultrafear is aerial therapy, stomp treatment, pure ripping that'll get you over the hump. Get your heart rate up and lean into the Ultra as you embrace the Fear. It'll work.

Artificial Intelligence. Alien abductions. Mysterious materials from Jupiter's ice moon. The CAPiTA Super DOA Snowboard combines tried and true twin tip style with super-materials straight out of a sci-fi movie to make one of the most impressive snowboards of our dimension. Upgraded with a new 3D Thermopolymer SuperCore and Moonshot Omni-Tune performance stone grind for maximum speed in any direction, it's a nebulous swirl of natural and supernatural elements all baked into a freestyle vessel that'll pop, butter, and spin like the deep space craft it is. All you're missing is an unexplained monolith to slide.

The CAPiTA Defenders of Awesome Snowboard is for riders who want to be remembered as heroes of shred. On the right side of history, whether regular footed or goofy. This board is on some intergalactic Excalibur wavelength, a weapon of righteous rad that'll slice through the BS and just plain rip. Park, high speed groomers, pow, leftovers, steeps, whatever: this is the choice for hot-dogging boardriders who prefer a cambered twin. With the future of Awesome at stake, how could you afford to ride anything else?

Stiff, directional, and full of power: the Jones Storm Wolf Snowboard is a classic fishtail surfer that loves to go fast. New this year, Jones moved the the stance inserts up 20mm to allow for a more centered stance and improve carving performance. The Surf Camber profile, long sidecut and Traction Tech Edges keep you on the snow while pulling long turns. Combining the shape and profile of the current Storm Chaser and the retired Lone Wolf, the Jones Storm Wolf Snowboard was made to rip.

The Jones Dream Weaver Snowboard is a one stop shop for all your riding. With this freerider on your side, there's no need to own 8 different boards, each optimized for a specific weather pattern that might roll through once or twice a season. The Dream Weaver is an all-mountain stoke factory: powerful enough to charge and playful enough to have fun with any line you point it down. It crushes everything from park to powder, and does it all with a confident, intuitive feel.

The Lib Tech Double Dip C2 Snowboard is "directional in both directions," designed to strip away sub-optimal stances in park and pow. Its tip and tail aren't shaped identically but they have the same surface area, making this board multidirectional. It's always pointing the right way, because there is no right way. Ya dig? This mid-volume shifted, short contact board is intended to be ridden 2-4cm longer than your normal board.

The Bataleon Stuntwood Snowboard is a scaled-down Evil Twin that reeks of teenage terror. As a full-on park board, the Stuntwood comes loaded with a bulletproof Superslick Base, and catch-free 3BT™ with SideKick™ in the nose and tail. Built for the next generation of park rats, this is the board to push the freestyle boundaries ever further.

The Salomon Super 8 Pro Snowboard is almost better than the snowboard movies thanks to an agile freeride design that favors speed and maneuverability. Featuring backseat camber that places control under your rear foot for quick, precise turns and better float in deep snow, the Super 8 Pro performs in any conditions you'll encounter from early winter to spring. Its quadratic sidecut works with the camber to provide quick edge to edge transitions and an Area 51 Base brings everything together with a need for speed.

"Send it. Do it. Go." That's the voice of the CAPiTA The Outsiders Snowboard in your ear, an angel / devil combo on your shoulder. Built with traditional camber and freestyle shenanigans in mind, this true twin snowboard instills confidence and encourages you to take chances. Boasting impressive pop, stability, and responsiveness, it handles the pressure with ample vibe damping and a nice blend of flex and edge hold. Don't hold back, take on that next freestyle challenge with The Outsider!

A freestyle ripper that will slay the park even in a semi-conscious state, the Salomon Sleepwalker Snowboard is a new board built around the skillset of Tommy Gesme. A true twin shape with tons of pop and a Rock Out Camber profile that pivots easily but still locks into rails like a bulldog, the Sleepwalker is a freestyle tool without equal and works even better if you're awake.

The Lib Tech Lost Mayhem Rocket C3 Snowboard is the result of a collaboration with renowned surfboard shaper Matt "Mayhem" Biolos, and it's a true powerhouse for conquering frozen waves. A directional big wave gun for powder days, the Rocket is made for holding on for dear life after those big drop-ins, with a powerful C3 profile and stiff flex to keep you upright. Boasting ample surface area, a wide nose, and a setback stance, it effortlessly planes through the snow and allows for effortless trenching. Prepare yourself for some big days out with the Lost Mayhem Rocket C3 Snowboard.

If you ain't first, you're last, and the Lib Tech TRS C3 Snowboard is the board of winners. Maple Org-Throttles provide massive energy transfer and C3 camber provides complete control and stability in every terrain. Magnetraction edges shred through ice and and basalt provides the strength and dampening you need to send it fast and big.

The Rome Freaker Snowboard isn't just for riders who are out of the mainstream, it's actually a super versatile board you can count on in any conditions and any terrain, and when you need some park chops once in a while. Built around Rome's durable StompCore with Bamboo HotRods for manageable power and pop, this board will let you get your freak on but still pass for a normal human being in lift line.

Light, strong and supremely versatile, the Rossignol One Snowboard is accurately named. Think you need a quiver of two or three boards to make it through the season? The Rossi One is the board that will change your mind, built around a L.I.T.E. Wood CBF core with Basalt and Aramid in the mix, and with a RadCut multi-radius sidecut that turns like a dream at both high and low speeds.

Love what you see people doing in the park, and want to try your hand at it? Start fresh with the Rossignol District Snowboard, an easy flexing, simple to turn and forgiving ride that absolutely promotes progression and maximizes fun. Geared toward newer riders, but not without the legendary Rossi quality, with a full wood core, ABS sidewalls, and tough extruded 4400 base, the District is the kind of board that's user friendly from the start but gracefully grows with you.

An all-mountain ripper of a board with no bad habits, the Nidecker Venus Snowboard doesn't snore or leave its clothes lying in the hallway. All it does is handle all manner of snow and terrain with a lively, poppy personality that makes snowboarding fun day in and day out. Directional CamRock delivers the perfect mix of edgehold and surfiness, and a flex of "6" is a great compromise between "surfy" and "chargey."

Unidentified Aerial Phenomenon. The Sims x evo UAP Snowboard is today's version of the Shaun Palmer UFO model of old, a classic from a polarizing rider who pushed as many boundaries as he did buttons. It's a long-nosed twin made for freestyling, hot dogging, and all around snow-based hooliganism. Stiff and traditionally-cambered, it's all about that pop, and the throwback shape will have you hunting for silver tuxedos and hair dye. Laid up with an evo exclusive limited edition topsheet, the Sims x evo UAP Snowboard will help you throw it back in style.

Find yourself in that sweet spot, comfortably in the pocket, fully in the groove: the Arbor Element Rocker Snowboard is like a new friend that you must've known in a past life, instantly at home everywhere. You can keep it casual or push it on this board, thanks to its well-rounded stats. It's surprising in its utility, this is a board that'll hold its own on any day the chairs are running. Periodic tabletops in the park and all-mountain freestyle synthesis are completely within the Element's realm.

The Jones Mind Expander Twin Snowboard is surf inspired, pow approved. A medium flex, tight sidecut, Christenson Surf CAMBER profile and 3D Contour Base 3.0 define this playful freeride board that loves to float. Enjoy a damp ride that's equal parts snappy and slashy as it is supportive. Jib, hit pillows, and take your style mountain wide with the Jones Mind Expander Twin Snowboard.

The Salomon Bellevue Split is the most sustainable freeride package. The reduced profile is built for fast uphill travel, so you can get to the top first and experience the best, untracked lines. Powder Camber provides extra float in the nose and controlled camber underfoot and the kit comes with Plum Hardware and pre-cut, cult-favorite Pomoca Skins. The base, top sheet, resins, and edges are all recycled or bio-based too, so the board is as light on the planet as it is on your feet.

The Arbor Draft Rocker Snowboard is a park and freestyle machine. Made for jumps, rails, and more, its soft flex and Arbor rocker profile thrives in the orange zone and beyond. Whether you're seeking out sidecountry booters or looking for something with lots of rebound on landings, the Coda Rocker gets it done in style.

Don't let the wide waist or huge nose fool you - the Salomon HPS - Wolle Nyvelt Fish Snowboard has the torsional flex to carve playful, precise turns on groomers, powder, and everything in between. Powder Camber stays afloat in bottomless pow thanks to the rockered nose but the camber underfoot and quadratic sidecut add pop to your turns for guaranteed face shots. Wolle Nyvelt is a powder pro, so you can trust his designs to soar through the deepest fall lines.

You don't have to be an heiress to enjoy the Rossignol Airis Snowboard. Serrated edges give you the confident grip you need in the park and Basalt and Kevlar fibers in the core bring stability and smoothness to your ride. The AmpTek All Mountain profile blends stable camber with forgiving rocker, so you can float, pop, and push your limits with confidence.

The Rome Mechanic Snowboard is a jack of all trades, the kind of board that's as comfortable on the bunny hill as it is in the park. The Contact rocker profile is easy to turn and the poplar Stompcore is stable and responsive. Bamboo Hot Rods add a little bit of snap as you start popping off side hits and the durable Impact base will see you through it all.

No need to disappear into the desert on a vision quest; just strap into the Jones Ultra Mind Expander Snowboard for an afternoon and throw the doors of perception wide open. Blending a directional shape with 3D Contour Base 3.0 and a smooth rocker profile designed by legendary surf shaper Chris Christenson, this elite level charger exists at the hallowed intersection of burly freeride, creative freestyle, and good old fashioned pow-surfing. Built with Jones premium Ultra construction for durability and top-end capability, the Ultra Mind Expander will have you looking at the mountain from a whole new perspective. In the latest model the insert packs have been moved forward 20mm to give options for a more centered stance and added power at the end of a carve.

The Arbor Swoon Rocker Splitboard will have you gushing with joy as you explore the backcountry. This board is built to optimize your experience on both the up and the down, offering plenty of grip and stability on the skin track and enough rocker for smooth turns on the descent. With a versatile medium flex, the Swoon rocker is laid back and ready for the fun ones, even if you're sweating buckets through the crux.

The Nitro Optisym Snowboard is a park and jib tool just waiting for your dose of inspiration - lively and easy-flexing, with the forgiving Dual Degressive Sidecut and the street-defying shock absorbing power of Polyurethane under the binding mount area. The Optisym also uses an extruded base, Rail Killer edges, and PU sidewalls for extra longevity, so you can continue to give 'er well after other boards have given up the ghost.

The Never Summer Proto Synthesis Snowboard is for the hard charging lady who demands performance and has the style and inclination to ride a true twin all over the mountain. Featuring Never Summer's classic Shockwave Rocker-Camber-Rocker profile for explosive energy and edgehold while still letting you surf your heart out.

Made in collaboration with evo Ambassador Erik Leon, the Arbor Relapse Snowboard is a park board for the people. This is a pro-caliber deck built to handle Erik's blend of park, street, and freestyle riding, but true to the mission of his C.O.R.E. Initiative, it's also super accessible for a wide range of riders. The soft flex and durable construction that do so well in the park also make it an easy board to learn to ride on, and the relatively modest price tag offers unbeatable value.

The Salomon Wonder Snowboard is the perfect companion for any rider looking to explore the groomers and beyod. Featuring a versatile directional twin shape, it offers exceptional edge control and stability in any terrain. With a responsive flex and powerful pop, it provides a smooth and fun ride for riders of all skill levels. Whether you're carving up the groomers or exploring the backcountry, the Salomon Wonder Snowboard will keep you on top of your game. It's a wonder you've lived so long without it!

The Bataleon Cruiser + Snowboard is a classic board that loves gliding and frolicking through variable conditions all over the mountain. Bring er' to the spring slush with style thanks to a long 3D nose and a stiff flex that provides stability at high speeds and in sketchier spots. If you like to surf through crust, mashed potatoes, and everything in between, the carbon enforced Bataleon Cruiser + is your ticket to a good time.

The K2 Vandal Snowboard is like a good teacher. It's the perfect blend of challenging and forgiving. It provides young riders with the tools they need to progress on the slopes, rewards success, and encourages experimentation. With this board on their feet, they'll soon find their skills blossoming, and their snowboarding report card will be all A's and S-turns.

The Jones Storm Chaser Snowboard is a purpose built ride designed for the deepest, most insane pow you'll find, and the right board for you if you live for that experience. Shaped for maximum speed and float with a wide waist and 3D Contour Base 3.0, the Storm Chaser is the rocket you're looking for to ignite the ultimate pow day.

The Lib Tech Banana Blaster BTX Snowboard is a beacon of progression for the next generation of freestyle riders. Built to make learning easy, but also to provide a powerful platform for young riders, this durable, high quality kids board was made in the eco-friendly Mervin factory in Washington state, USA. It's easy to ride slow, easy to ride hard, and easy to get stoked about so the love of snowboarding lives on.

The Ride Burnout Snowboard is an all purpose freestyle machine you can take to the streets. This is the pick for the modern rider who finds inspiration and air in places most people can't imagine, but still rolls hard all over the mountain. A linear sidecut, true twin shape, medium flex, and tons of camber spell out all around excellence in freestyle performance. Toss in burly oversized edges, a speedy sintered base, and an array of carbon fibers designed to increase pop and dampen harsh landings, and you've got the makings of a classic.

What is the craziest line down your local hill? Probably something steep and techy with a few more cliff drops than you'd like. Whatever it is, the Ride Berzerker Snowboard is up to the task. It's engineered for the most manic descents down any terrain, but it isn't too stiff or one dimensional for normal resort duty, either. It has a directional shape and a fairly stout flex, but feels poppy and lively bouncing from edge to edge and feature to feature, thanks to a tapered shape and quadratic sidecut. It's perfect for the advanced rider doing their thing and playing with terrain.

The Ride Heartbreaker Snowboard is an easygoing twin shape with a soft flex, dependable feel, and a playful personality. It's a winner for beginner to intermediate riders progressing in the park and beyond, and offers fantastic bang for your buck if you're stepping up from rentals. If you're looking for a board that will have you riding better and feeling more confident all over the mountain, this is the one for you.

Wolle Nyvelt's design marches on with the Salomon Sickstick Snowboard filling a much needed spot in the all-mountain ripper lineup. This versatile tapered twin employs Salomon's finest tech, from Rock Out Camber (camber under each foot) to the extensive use of bamboo, finishing up with the ultra fast Sintered EG base to get you down in a hurry.

The Ride Lowride Snowboard is designed for little shredders on the up, with a catch free Twin Rocker profile that makes turning easy as pie. Fun, forgiving, and expertly crafted to encourage progression, the Lowride is sure to spark a lifetime of Winter stoke.

Sure, powder is great, but have you ever felt the pure adrenaline rush of launching into a huge, corked out 720? You'll need a lot of practice to get there, and the Bataleon Blow Snowboard is here to help. With a mellow flex, Bataleon's proven Triple Base Technology, and beefy Shock Walls construction, this easy-rider is the perfect platform freestyle progression both in and out of the park.

Everyone has a doppleganger but none of us want to run into these bad luck harbingers. The Bataleon Evil Twin Snowboard is the one alter ego you'll be happy you found, thanks to 3BT™ uplifted sidebases and medium camber that will absolutely destroy competition in the park. The carbon Central Super Tube and lightweight core are snappy and lightweight for maximum air and the medium flex is versatile enough to bop around the rest of the mountain when you want to hit some natural features. It's the classic Bataleon board that just gets better with age.

Non-stop never-stop, from the bottom to the top. Again and again, still and forever. The Lib Tech Jamie Lynn C3 Snowboard is ready for the gnarliest run you know, and it's ready right now. It's not nervous, though, because it's got an aggressive C3 camber, a roast-anywhere flex, and a shape that's made to take full advantage of the conditions. Not to mention the pedigree of years of all-over shredding under the feet of the man himself. This one says Jamie Lynn on it. Take it to your favorite natural hit and do it justice with the best method you can muster!

The Salomon No Drama Snowboard brings girls of all abilities together to hit jumps, ride rails, and cause havoc throughout the park. Its true twin shape excels riding either regular or switch and the combination of Quad Camber with EQ Rad Sidecut is stable, snappy, and agile. The stiff flex can handle big landings and the Royal Rubber Pads give extra protection to your sidewalls, so you can jib off any feature and leave your worries and drama at home.

Learning how to snowboard can feel like a slog at times, but there's nothing better than the feeling of getting a little better every time you go out. The Bataleon Chaser Snowboard makes it easier to chase down those small, everyday wins with a design that encourages progression. A soft flex, full wood core, and Bataleon's signature Triple Base Technology™ combine for a smooth, easygoing ride that puts your riding front and center.

The Lib Tech Rasman C2X Snowboard is your every day terrain muncher, no matter what the mountain tries to throw at you. Magne-Traction edges turn ice into fairy dust and C2X camber/rocker profile is powerful and precise for all-mountain performance. It's the best of the best, Natural Selection on full display.

When your kiddo starts riding harder than you, it's time to upgrade to the Burton Feelgood Smalls Snowboard. This is a smaller version of the classic Feelgood shape sized for lighter riders, with the same build quality and attention to detail as the adult model. A versatile PurePop Camber profile and snappy Super Fly® 800G Core mean the Feelgood Smalls is fully equipped to take all mountain terrain in stride.

Every snowboarding season has a beginning, a middle, and an end. It starts off with wobbly legs, excitement, and a rekindling of love lost, moves through the usual plot twists of huge storms, choking pow days, and long road trips to new locales, and closes out with a heady mix of sun-baked slush and big, filled in lines tackled with the strength and confidence gained from a full season of shredding. The Burton Story Board Snowboard is the perfect vehicle for expert riders ready to do it all over again – a powerful freeride deck with high end materials and the guts to keep going, day after day. The End.

The Burton Flight Attendant Snowboard isn't here to putz around in lower altitudes. This directional powerhouse has its sights set a little higher, with a firm flex and a wide body design capable of hammering through chunder, and stomping landings without ruffling a feather. Combining a lightweight wood core with powerful Carbon I-Beam reinforcement, it's the perfect freeride board for advanced riders opening up the throttle and catching air every chance they get.

Say yes to fresh snow. Say yes to frosty mornings, early wake up calls, and full throated carpool singalongs on the drive up to the mountain. The Burton Yeasayer Snowboard is with you every step of the way, with Burton's easygoing Flat Top™ rocker profile for catch-free fun and a forgiving flex that won't send you packing for the lodge when conditions are rough. Like a great riding companion, the Yeasayer is a confidence multiplyer, a ray of sunshine that's guaranteed to take your riding to new heights.

The Burton Feelgood Snowboard provides the kind of warm-and-fuzzy feels that can only be achieved by spending epic days in the mountains. It's a classic all mountain shape steeped in Burton quality, pairing traditional camber with Burton's energetic Super Fly II™ 700G Core and Carbon I-Beam reinforcement for smooth, chatter-free performance in all conditions. Make this your daily driver and turn that frown upside down.

The Burton Custom X Snowboard is the specced-out version of the classic, pairing all of the top materials and construction techniques in the Burton arsenal with the timeless Custom shape. The combination of traditional camber with a directional twin shape and a setback stance is straight out of the snowboarding hall of fame, a tried and true recipe for all mountain prowess. Add a featherweight Dragonfly™ 600G wood core and stiff, chatter damping carbon highlights, and the Custom X is capable of crushing the biggest, baddest lines on the hill. This one is an easy slam dunk for aggressive riders.

When you're planning on slashing through billowing lines of pow, there's nothing like having the right tool for the job, and that tool is the Burton Family Tree Pow Wrench. Ride this compact shape short to take full advantage of its ability to change direction in a flash; the long rocker profile and flat camber combined with the hex-wrench tail cutout make sure you'll never experience anything less than a surreal, floatatious ride in anything over 4 inches.

Get into the rhythm of the park on the Arbor Cadence Camber Snowboard, an all-around ripper for front side days lapping features and corduroy with your pals. Featuring a mid-soft flex and system camber, the Cadence has bold artwork and loves to ride at high speeds. Fully wrapped sidewalls and 3 degree fenders create a durable platform that lands big jumps with stability and ease. The Arbor Cadence Camber Snowboard goes as long as you can, guaranteed.

Push out those thoughts of mundane driving in a Honda Civic... With the Burton Family Tree 3D Daily Driver Snowboard, you'll feel like you've been blessed by the snow gods themselves. This fully cambered all-mountain masterpiece combines a directional shape with a dose of 3D contours, giving you the ultimate blend of stability and surfy playfulness. So whether you're dropping cliffs or carving up fresh powder, the Daily Driver will make you feel like a snow-slicing superhero.

Grab the Burton Hideaway Snowboard for its easygoing personality and smooth turning capabilities, and strike out on a new snowboarding career. This is the perfect board to hole up by yourself in a secret location and ride every day until you get it. The Flat Top profile gives you plenty of control and easy turn initiation, and the mellow directional shape gives you the power to carve out groomers and dance through a bit of fluff. Nobody makes "learner" snowboards like Burton, and the Hideaway is one of the best.

The CAPiTA Black Snowboard of Death Snowboard has been tearing around in pursuit of the goods for over 20 years, and it remains one of the best all mountain boards in the game. This is still the progressive, directional board you know, and love, ready to thread the needle in technical terrain, demolish fields of untracked pow, and lay filthy trenches on the cord.

A homage to the origins of pow, the Arbor Single Camber Snowboard is a big mountain board with a huge nose and tapered pintail design. It brings extra stability and increased float when pushing through deep snow and arcing wide turns. This surface is so huge, Arbor recommends you size down. Complete with GripTech for edge hold and eco friendly materials, the Arbor Single Camber Snowboard celebrates the earth while making every turn worthy of celebration.

Go big or go home on the Arbor Coda Camber Snowboard, an all mountain twin designed for big mountain hits and fast riding. Featuring Arbor's Rise Above Plastic top, it sheds snow, weight, and decreases production waste so you can feel great about your purchase every time you ride. The double barrel two wood core is durable yet lightweight, and classic system camber makes the Coda responsive and dependable on when you need to dig in. Hit the mountain with a bang, on the Arbor Coda Camber Snowboard you'll never want the day to end.

The Arbor Wasteland Camber Snowboard lays claim to the mountain with its classic twin design and traditional wood layup. For advanced to expert riders who like to hit a bit of everything, its 4 point camber system shines at speed and through deep carves. Show off your skils all around the mountain with the Wasteland Camber, an ash dyed classic worthy of long days and sendy ways.

Bring out the fire within and unlock your freeride potential on the Arbor Candle Rain Camber Snowboard. Designed for powder, big mountain, and resort riding, the Pat Moore designed Candle Rain Camber is a directional twin that can do it all. Blending traditional snowboard design with innovative eco friendly materials and a responsive Double Barrel II wood core, this is a powerful platform for riders pushing the limits both in and out of bounds.

Smooth. Everything about the United Shapes Cadet Snowboard is cool, understated, and downright beautiful. From its looks to its on-snow behavior, this is a no-nonsense board that lets your riding do the talking. It's a moderately stiff, traditionally cambered directional board, always a recipe for the best all-rounders on the hill. And with this deep sidecut, you'll be all around the hill for sure: high speed carves and precision on steeps are all well within its purview. The Cadet is beautiful in simplicity.

The all new Ride Deep Fake Snowboard is a freeride specialist with big ambitions. Those ambitions include - but are not limited to - slaying pow, zooming groomers, and world domimation. Ride's Directional Extra Camber profile combines with their Tapered Linear Quadratic Sidecut for incredible stability, power, and edge-hold for no-speed-limit riding, while brand new Metal Slimwall comstruction adds a layer of Titanal into the mix for improved durability and response. The Deep Fake is no joke, take a rip and find out!

Athlete tested, athlete approved. The Arbor Bryan Iguchi Pro Camber Splitboard is an uphill fiend designed to bring freeride snowboarding out of bounds. With a classic system camber profile to assist you in steep terrain and on the skin track, the Bryan Iguchi Pro is powerful, precise, and ready for everything the backcountry throws your way.

Ride like a pro with the Nidecker Sensor Plus Snowboard. Designed for advanced park shredders who demand precision and power when they hit the XL jump line, this board features a responsive camber profile and carbon construction for unparalleled control and speed. Whether you're riding around the mountain or practicing new moves in the park, the Sensor Plus will elevate your performance to the next level. Get ready to feel the rush of the mountain like never before.

This little piggy went to the groomer, this little piggy went to the park. But the Ride MTNpig Snowboard went to the powder, and slayed huge lines 'til dark. If your idea of hog heaven is romping around the biggest terrain your mountain has to offer and seeking out the deepest snow you can find, the King of Bacon is the only board for you. This big pig is the most teched out, directionally destructive member of Ride's infamous Warpig lineage. If you're not already impressed by the insane half-moon split tail or laundry list of carbon reinforcements in this thing, just take it out there and go huck some ham off a cliff - you'll see what we mean.

Take your riding to the next level with the Salomon Oh Yeah Snowboard. This women's freestyle board is designed with a medium-soft flex and Rock Out Camber for versatility all over the mountain. Equipped with Popster core and rubber pads underfoot for extra durability when you start sending it, you'll be popping off side hits and sending it with speed in no time.

The K2 First Lite Snowboard is the perfect starting point for beginner and intermediate riders seeking a comfortable and predictable ride. Whether you're cruising groomers or exploring new terrain, the forgiving Catch-Free Tune and forgiving Twin Rocker profile provide an effortlessly smooth and stress-free experience on the slopes.

The K2 Niseko Pleasures Snowboard is the stuff of powder dreams, specifically crafted for the legendary Japanese snow mecca itself. If you've got a foot or two of powder to spare, and a blank canvas to play with, this directional board is as good of a companion as you could ever ask for. Despite it being a powder-friendly shape, it still comes with a fair amount of camber between the feet, making it an excellent choice for freeriders seeking precision and power to go along with all that float.

Can you dig it? CAN YOU DIG IT? No, we're not quoting an iconic line from 1979 cult favorite, 'The Warriors', we're talking about the K2 Excavator Snowboard. The question is rhetorical, because we're pretty sure that you will, in fact, dig it. With a fat nose and slight swallowtail, the Excavator features a smooth al dente flex pattern that blends camber underfoot with rocker up front. Pre-cambered Carbon Power Forks in the tail provide extra snap for ollies and precise turn exits, while the multi-radius sidecut helps with turn initiation. From powder to corduroy, frontside to back, this freerider is the perfect match.

The GNU Hyper C2X Snowboard is a blank slate, and we're not just talking about the minimalist graphics. Its directional shape, Magne-Traction edges, and insanely responsive layup let your style do the talking whether you're hunting leftover pow, painting clean arcs on fresh cord, or taking your park antics to the sidecountry. It's smooth and powerful, stomps hard, carves well, and pivots surprisingly easily for a board of it's size. If you're looking for a new medium for all mountain expression, this Blake Paul pro model is a great way to make your mark.

Your skills deserve more than a matte finish. The GNU Gloss C2 Snowboard provides a much needed glow up, pairing easygoing C2e Contour rocker with grippy Magne-Traction serrated edges for catch-free edge control. It's perfect for the rider carving smooth, flowy runs down the groomers and dabbling in the park. Hand built in the USA at Mervin's eco-friendly facility, the Gloss is bound to get the creative juices flowing whenever you head to the mountain.

When slopestyle queen Jamie Anderson isn't busy winning Olympic and X-Games gold medals, she's designing the gear to get her there. The GNU Asym Pro Choice C3 Snowboard distills everything she needs to push progression at the highest level into one pro-level deck for the masses. It has C3 camber for stability and pop on high speed jump lines, Magne-Traction® edges for unreal grip, and an asymmetric design that works with the body for a more natural and dynamic ride feel. If you're going big both in and out of the park, the Pro Choice is the right choice for you.

The GNU Free Spirit C3 Snowboard is all delivering that euphoric out-of-body experience on the slopes, while keeping your actual body in complete control of proceedings. The directional, volume shifted design floats through pow and maneuvers tight spaces with speed and skill that regular boards just can't match. Powerful C3 camber gives it stability and pop while lightweight, tapered construction and a 3" setback make it easier than ever to surf and slash when the going gets deep. Snowboarding has rarely felt so good.

The GNU 4x4 C3 Snowboard is Forest Bailey's big mountain weapon for the deepest days and burliest lines of the season. It has a stiff chassis and powerful C3 camber providing plenty of drive, accompanied by Mange-Traction serrated edges for serious grip on firmer ground. Despite it's directional twin design and aggressive DNA, this board is nimble, lively, and easy to spin – the perfect choice for freestyle riders taking their park moves to more natural terrain.

The Jones Stratos Snowboard is a modern day freeride icon with deep roots in the ancient art of freestyle. The name alone evokes a timeless, elevated quality, as if strapping in grants the rider access to the upper reaches of the stratosphere, hucking thousand foot cliffs and stomping landings on monstrous cumulonimbus clouds. It's heady stuff, but this board delivers down here in the surface realm, too. The hybrid shape blends the directional feel of a freeride charger with the narrow sidecut and playful flex of a freestyle specialist. With 10mm of taper and Float Pack Inserts, it crushes pow on the deepest days, and it's the first board you'll reach for when the groomers are firing. Add the Stratos to your quiver and it's all up for grabs. Go get some!

The Jones Aviator 2.0 Snowboard is a directional twin for advanced riders hitting the resort with all guns blazing. It incorporates a featherweight honeycomb Koroyd material in the nose for superior vibration damping at high speeds, and a full camber profile for the best possible edge-hold and pop. This thing turns every pillow into a launchpad, every cat track into a kicker, and stomps landings with sledgehammer confidence.

The super solid Basic with a faster base and a poppier flex pattern, the Yes. Typo Snowboard is a bona fide classic. This isn't some surfy backcountry pow board, it's a park and resort board made to accompany your rise to the top of the pro ranks: a pure freestyle machine meant for the highest levels of trickery. When you make it big, make sure they spell your name right!

The Jones Solution Splitboard has the answer key for every backcountry conundrum. Slippy skintracks? The grippy Traction Tech 2.0 inner edges hold on like velcro. Promised pow turns into dust-on-crust or chunder chip death cookies? No problem, the powerful Ultra Split Core with Flax / Basalt reinforcement provides chatter-free performance and high-speed response when the snow is less than ideal. And when conditions do line up to provide perfection? The Solution's dialed shape and proven directional rocker combine for effortless float and flow that'll have you staying out for as many laps as your legs can handle.

You're that kind of rider - you've got weather systems and telemetries from every mountain range within 1,000 miles ready to call up on your phone, you watch the status of the offshore systems like a hawk, and you're ready to drop work and head for the mountains any time there's a forecast of more than 6 inches of snow. You deserve the Jones Storm Chaser Splitboard to match your mindset - a full-blown powder rocket with a seam down the middle to allow you access to the best snow on earth. A surf-style profile developed by board shaper extraordinaire Chris Christenson means you'lll never bog down in the deep again, and split-specific tech courtesy of Jones and Karakoram mean you'll have no trouble getting to the goods.

Celestial forces are always at work, affecting everything we do in the mountains. The Weston Eclipse Splitboard is a spaceship of a snowslider, as tech as an intergalactic schooner from the Xargox System, but as down to earth and intuitive as the best smartphone UI. This board is all freeride, especially if you enjoy freeriding in deep pow: it's at home weaving through trees and swooping through chutes, and a delight to travel on. A super stable yet maneuverable board--just what you're looking for! Bonus points if you ride it under moonlight or during an eclipse, by the way.

The Cardiff Lynx Boundary Snowboard is built for riders of all abilities. This smooth twin tip floater features a paulownia and poplar core, with a soft flex and stable platform that turns easy and rips groomers like a dream. Whether you're hitting the slopes for the first time or love boards that are nimble and don't hook, it's the perfect choice for in bounds adventures big and small.

Get back in the woods--immediately! The Weston Backwoods Splitboard is Weston's idea of the perfect splitboard. It's designed to flourish in every condition you're likely to find on your adventures, with a solid freeride shape, medium/stiff flex, and bomber construction. There's plenty of pow float built in to this lightweight board, with a rockered nose and a bit of taper along its length. Camber in between your feet help grip on hardpack and skin tracks, and all the little split-specific tech bits add up to a perfect splitboard. You can only ride one at a time, so you may as well get one as versatile as the Backwoods!

Fresh off a thorough renovation for the new season, the new Jones Mind Expander Splitboard still rocks the surf-derived shape dreamed up by Chris Christenson and Jeremy Jones, but with the stance moved forward 20cm for better hard snow performance and a re-distributed flex that's a bit softer between the bindings and a bit stiffer at the nose. As before, your enjoyment of steep sidehills is enhanced by Inner/Outer Traction Tech 1.0 edges and full Karakoram hardware make this board ride more like a solid than a split.

Say hello to the Roxy Dawn Snowboard: a progression oriented board for beginner to advanced riders. Designed by Mervin with a soft flex and Magne-Traction®, it offers control like no other. Whether you're a snowboarding aficionado or new to the sport, this board will help you make the most of any day on the hill.

You love the idea of bringing your carefully cultivated bag of freestyle tricks to the BC, but first you need to get up the hill? The Cardiff Crane Enduro Splitboard was built with you in mind. The Enduro built is Cardiff's most durable and bombproof, the HALFcamber65 profile adds plenty of spice to your ride, and the Crane Enduro split flies uphill, well, like a bird.

You know it when you feel it - a Platonic ideal brought to life for a few fleeting moments of gravity fed bliss. Like the Wizard of Oz bursting into technicolor after a lifetime of sepia, the perfect turn changes everything. The Season Forma Snowboard is crafted to seek it wherever it lies, with a volume shifted swallowtail design that harks back to the early days of surf shaping. This throwback pow shape offers dolphin-like agility in deep snow, but crank it up to speed on firmer ground and the Forma gives as good as it gets, begging you to get low and drag a hand.

Pick your line with the Yes. PYL Snowboard, a fast, stiff, and directional freeride powder monster that delivers float and fun without compromising on functionality. Constructed with triax fiberglass and a stiff yet lightweight mix of Poplar and Paulownia, this board has more edge hold and power than you've ever dreamed of in a tapered board. With wavy art, this naturally damp platform brings high performance feel to wherever you ride.

The Salomon Lotus Snowboard is a versatile and beginner-friendly board that is perfect for riders looking to progress their skills on the mountain. With its Flat Out Camber profile and Bite Free edges, this board offers a stable, forgiving, and easy to control ride. The directional shape and medium flex make it ideal for cruising groomers or exploring the whole mountain. The Aspen core and extruded base provide durability and smoothness in all conditions, while the radial sidecut allows for smooth and effortless turns. The Lotus is a reliable and affordable choice for women who want to take their snowboarding to the next level.

When Jeremy Jones turns his attention to freestyle, you know it's going to hit different. The Jones Ultra Mountain Twin Snowboard is a specced out ripper for expert riders laying the freestyle hammer down in big, bad terrain. Its versatile CamRock profile and powerful flex allow you to crank through your repetoire of spins and butters without sacrificing float or stability, and freeride / freestyle pack inserts mean you can switch up your stance as conditions change. If there's a better all-mountain freestyle weapon for the creative charger, we haven't found it.

Xavier De Le Rue knows a thing or two about big mountain riding, and it shines through in every detail of his signature deck. The Rossignol XV Snowboard is stiff, responsive, explosively poppy, and supremely confident when the sketch factor is high. Vibration damping Aramid and Basalt laminates keep things nice and composed when you launch into a puckering straight line, and pow friendly AmpTek Elite Rocker combines with Roller Base Technology for effortless maneuverability and float in deep snow. Keep it up and the Rossignol XV Snowboard might just bag you a FWT win or two.

Fed on a steady diet of park features and side hits, a solid freestyle board grew tired of the same old lines down manicured slopes and developed a hunger for more satiating meals. The Arbor Shiloh Camber Snowboard is a big mountain twin, reinforced with bamboo and ready to devour the cliff drops and pow stashes at the grown-ups table. It's fast, stable, and smooth in natural terrain, but it hasn't forgotten its roots either. This full rockered shape is loaded with pop and well-balanced in the air, perfect for your all-mountain freestyle goals.

The Salomon Sight X Snowboard is a freeride inspired board designed for all-mountain riders who demand performance and versatility. With a directional shape and medium flex, it's perfect for cruising groomers, floating through soft snow, and tackling steep terrain. The Quadralizer sidecut provides maximum edge control, while the Ghost Basalt Stringers offer a smooth and responsive ride. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned rider, the Salomon Sight Snowboard is an excellent choice for exploring every run on the hill. Plus A unique evo colorway gives this board a little extra flair.

We're not saying you're here to start trouble, but if there's trouble to be had all it usually needs is a little catalyst. The Burton Instigator Flat Top Snowboard is that spark you're looking for, especially if your aim is to fire up your freestyle tricks. This version of the Instigator features a Flat Top profile geared toward speedy progression and catch-free landings, and the soft flex delivers a smooth, easy turning ride. Ignite your snowboarding career and don't look back.

If your usual route takes you from the park to the ridgelines and everywhere in between, the Salomon Assassin Pro Snowboard is the board you need for all-mountain snow sliding. Ghost Carbon Beams and the Ghost Green Core add mega pop to your jumps but are light enough to haul on hikes to sidecountry summits. Gunslinger carbon sidewalls absorb chatter and the stiff flex makes for a high-speed ride that can land cliffs and carve groomers all the way back to the lift.

Crafted for park hits and freestyle fun, the Arbor Draft Camber Snowboard has a soft flex pattern for responsive landings and a classic camber profile with Grip Tech digs into carves when you're not in the air. And a bright topsheet by artist Samborghini brings a vibrant airbrushed look to Arbor's classic eco friendly design. Send it big and enjoy the pops, tweaks, and turns of the park on the Arbor Draft Camber Snowboard.

Get ready to leave your beginner status in the icy dust with the Burton Ripcord Snowboard. Like it's namesake, this board is a microwaveable masterclass in progression, making every run feel like a victory lap. With its forgiving flex, catch-free ride, and effortless maneuverability, the Ripcord is your golden ticket to quickly feeling comfortable on a snowboard carving up the mountain like a seasoned pro in very short order.

If you're a lil' stinker who wants the pow and wants it now, get on the GNU Gremlin C3 Snowboard and go make some mischief. This little rascal is made with directional float and explosive C3 Camber for mountain mayhem of the highest order. Not only that, its volume shifted design means you can size down a couple cm for an insanely nimble ride that'll have you pilfering lines and snaking stashes til dawn.

The Jones Stratos Snowboard is a modern day freeride icon with deep roots in the ancient art of freestyle. The name alone evokes a timeless, elevated quality, as if strapping in grants the rider access to the upper reaches of the stratosphere, hucking thousand foot cliffs and stomping landings on monstrous cumulonimbus clouds. It's heady stuff, but this board delivers down here in the surface realm, too. The hybrid shape blends the directional feel of a freeride charger with the narrow sidecut and playful flex of a freestyle specialist. With 10mm of taper and Float Pack Inserts, it crushes pow on the deepest days, and it's the first board you'll reach for when the groomers are firing. Add the Stratos to your quiver and it's all up for grabs. Go get some!

The Yes. 420 Snowboard is your new best bud. This thing floats like a cloud. A classic cambered pow board with a mid stiff flex, the 420 will have you riding high on top of fresh pow. Shorter boards that turn like a dream are all the rage, and Yes has been in the game long before pow surfing was legal. Let's be blunt, the Yes. 420 Snowboard is dope!

The Salomon Rumble Fish Snowboard is designed for the adventurous rider who seeks one board to rule them all. Its hybrid camber profile offers excellent stability and response, while the tapered shape and medium flex allow for easy turn initiation and control in any terrain. With a sintered base and Ghost Basalt Stringers for added pop, this board is perfect for charging through powder or carving down groomers alike.

When they're progressing like crazy and tackling lines that have you going back and forth between parental fear and pride, it's time to hook them up with a tool that can really develop their skills; the Jones Prodigy Snowboard. Designed with high-quality materials, an easygoing flex, and a versatile directional twin shape with directional rocker, the Prodigy helps them find their way as they develop their own unique style.

The Arbor Satori Camber Snowboard is one of Bryan Iguchi's love children. Made in short lengths for pow lovers, its freestyle oriented and has a deep sidecut for frothy carves. Paired with a medium flex and a stable tail, the Satori Camber is a wonderful choice for anyone looking for a friendly and approachable deep day destroyer that's extra fun. Imagine sitting around a fire with your best friends sipping drinks and laughing; that's what the Satori evokes, and we bet Iguchi is extra proud.

The Salomon Assassin Snowboard is a directional twin board designed to ride anything, anytime. Acting as a cross between Salomon's progressive pow and freestyle boards, its hybrid camber profile provides a perfect blend of camber and rocker, for a a responsive and playful ride. Poppy, agile, and ready to play, the Salomon Assassin Snowboard offers premium performance from the park to the pow.

Spend a season in the park and you'll see why the rail sliders, box boopers, and jump line maniacs think of themselves as family. Day after day honing skills, hollering encouragement, and picking your homies up off the snow to have another crack at nailing that. one. friggin'. trick. It shifts your perception of what matters, of why we do the things we do. The Season Kin Snowboard is a directional twin shape for the whole freestyle fam - men, women, young, and old. It has symmetrical camber for added grip and energy, a playful, pressable flex, and durable construction engineered to stand up to everyday abuse in the park and beyond.

Never Summer's stiffest freeride board for women simply gets it done, whether bottomless pow, steep technical terrain, or slamming the corduroy on the way back to the lodge. The Never Summer Lady FR Snowboard gets a directional shape with 5mm of taper, a stout flex, 3/4" setback, and Float Mechanics to rule the deep days. The addition of a Triple Camber Fusion rocker profile, with more camber between the bindings, really concentrates your power underfoot and delivers the best in hard pack performance.

Sure, a new graphic now and then is nice, but in terms of design we're all for not fixing what ain't broken, and the Nitro Team Snowboard certainly fits that description. With more sizes and widths than ever, this standby rides as well in backcountry pow as it does on the groomed, and gives you a head start on the competition whenever there's goods to be had.

Say yes to fresh snow. Say yes to frosty mornings, early wake up calls, and full throated carpool singalongs on the drive up to the mountain. The Burton Yeasayer Snowboard is with you every step of the way, with Burton's playful Flying V rocker profile and an easygoing flex that won't send you packing for the lodge when conditions are rough. Like a great riding companion, the Yeasayer is a confidence multiplyer, a ray of sunshine that's guaranteed to take your riding to new heights.

The K2 Alchemist Snowboard is a directional big gun engineered for full throttle freeriding. A stiff, full camber build ensures tons of power and edge hold, while its setback stance and upturned nose keep you on top of the snow, even in the deepest conditions. K2 has left no stone unturned when it comes to technology. The new S1 Core, Spectral Braid, and SpaceGlass Tip combine for a super powerful and stable ride that will have you outrunning your friends, and its high-grade carbon and fiber glass construction means that it's super light and nimble. From cliff drops to face shots, this is the only board you'll ever need.

Find yourself in that famed sweet spot, comfortably in the pocket, fully in the groove: the Arbor Element Camber Snowboard is like a new friend that you must've known in a past life, instantly familiar. You can keep it casual or push it on this board thanks to a versatile design that lets you call the shots. It's surprising in its utility, this is a board that'll hold its own on any day the chairs are running. Strong, eco friendly materials round out a capable all-mountain freestyle package you can rep all season.

Designed by father/son duo Temple and Cannon Cummins, the GNU Banked Country C3 Snowboard is a do-it-all resort ripper for advanced riders chasing their next adrenaline rush. It's got a big, floaty nose, powerful construction, and directional progressive Magne-Traction technology designed to put extra bite in the tail of directional boards. Featuring a redesigned tail shape for easier switch riding, this everyday crusher is ready for action.

Every year, evo employees scatter across the West to various demos, riding and testing countless snowboards. There are usually a few standouts, a handful of notable boards that the collective seems to gravitate towards. Last year, there was one that stood tall: the Ride Peace Seeker Snowboard. No-one could stop talking about it, and no-one could stop riding it. The magic lies in a tapered directional shape that exels on groomers and pow alike, a shape that floats like a butterfly and carves like a champ. It's fast, precise, smooth, and the hype is real.

The CAPiTA Outerspace Living Snowboard is the perfect match for those who head out with a "freeride, but make it fun" style. It's an all terrain directional twin that with a hybrid camber profile and a slight setback, making it an excellent choice for shredding in powder, crud, and challenging terrain. Also, the newly added Certified Multizone Core enhances the board's durability and strength in high-impact zones, taking a bit of sting out of coming up short. This board is an excellent choice for anyone looking to explore the outer limits and venture into deep space like a freestyle blastronaut.

Some people think paradise is a tropical beach with white sands, warm water, and colorful drinks with little umbrellas in them. We believe that everyone's opinion is valid and deserves respect, and also that those people are wrong. We know for a fact that paradise is that last big storm of the year, when every line is filled in and covered with a fresh fluffy blanket, your legs are in prime shredding shape from a season of riding, the sun is out and shining, and you get to spend the whole day at your favorite resort with your best friends. The CAPiTA Paradise Snowboard is built with that exact idea in mind. It's got generous rocker in the tip and tail to float through pow and blast through chop, a smooth medium flex to lay some some sweet turns, and a true twin shape to show off a little bit on some end of the day park laps. Everything goes, all the landings are spotless. Welcome to paradise.

Scritch scritch. The Lib Tech Box Scratcher BTX Snowboard still delivers the same vibe the very first reverse camber boards did, all those years ago. Combined with a softer flex and perfect twin shape, this board is super fun in – and on the way to – the park. Lockin in to back lips, magically spinning like a top across boxes, boosting huge QP airs: these goals are all on the Box Scratcher's radar. It's a Box ticker, in that sense.

Dustin Craven's standards are a bit higher than most: when you're at the forefront of riding insane backcountry lines that tends to happen. The Yes. Standard UnInc Snowboard is a pumped up version of the fantastic Standard, with a little more support and precision to deal with those no-fall situations. This is a mid-wide board that shows none of the sluggishness that can sometimes come with that extra width through the middle. This Standard is as quick and solid as can be – just watch Craven ride it for proof!

The Jones Airheart 2.0 Snowboard is a flying machine, built to make you feel 10 feet tall and ready for any day's conditions. This is a ripping park board that is capable of delivering the best damn overall ride of your life, a full-on freestyle-anywhere machine. Boasting a Power Camber profile for stability and pop, with Carbon / Innegra fibers in the layup for torsional stiffness and power, the Airheart is an elite all-mountain freestyle ripper for the fearless woman who likes to ride fast and go big. Legendary performance is just an everyday thing for the Jones Airheart Snowboard.

There are endless horizons everywhere you look in snowboarding: going around a powdery knoll and disappearing over a park jump landing are both worthy of your efforts, and the United Shapes Horizon Snowboard is always moving along. This directional twin has a medium flex, making it a solid performer in the park, but it really opens up when you head away from the confines of sculpted obstacles. Natural hits and all-mountain freestyling are where the Horizon shines, with plenty of float for pow and a versatile shape that can get rad on anything.

Fed on a steady diet of park features and side hits, a solid freestyle board grew tired of the same old lines down manicured slopes and developed a hunger for more satiating meals. The Arbor Shiloh Rocker Snowboard is a big mountain twin, reinforced with bamboo and ready to devour the cliff drops and pow stashes at the grown-ups table. It's fast, stable, and smooth in natural terrain, but it hasn't forgotten its roots either. This full rockered shape is loaded with pop and well-balanced in the air, perfect for your all-mountain freestyle goals.

Whether you are out exploring corners of the mountain, exposing yourself to unknown and new terrain on your progression grind, or you're the rider who goes wherever the wind takes you — laps through the park, ripping trees, finding powder when it's there, the Nidecker Merc SE Snowboard was made for you. Designed to be a one-and-done quiver killer, the Merc is a mid-flex all-mountain board ready to answer any call of duty. Without being a powerlifter, riders can load up the CamRock in the core and tail with relative ease and receive ample response for big pop in their ollies and smooth and powerful carving. Exclusive to evo, the Nidecker Merc SE Snowboard is the best value on snow!

If you thought Austin Smith was going to stop at the ropeline and let someone else plunder the deep stuff, you thought wrong. The Season Pass Splitboard is a one-way ticket to backcountry nirvana designed to make the most out of life on the skin track. Based on the all terrain Nexus snowboard, the Season Pass brings powder to the people with a versatile directional twin shape and sizing appropriate for both men and women, young and old. Throw in some pre-cut climbing skins and a durable layup engineered for longevity, and you've got the perfect platform to earn your turns season after season.

Unleash your freeride potential with the Arbor Bryan Iguchi Pro Camber Snowboard, a high-performance deck designed by legend Bryan Iguchi. Offering powerful camber for precision turns, stability, and explosive pop, this board rides with supreme confidence in all conditions. With years of high level riding and industry knowledge under his belt, Iguchi brings class and performance to all his boards: get on one today and experience the thrill for yourself.

The Salomon Huck Knife Pro Snowboard is a high performance park board designed to meet the freestyle needs of flippers and huckers around the mountains. A true twin, the Huck Knife Pro features an aggressive camber profile designed to absorb impacts and keep you steady, both before and after big air. The lightweight Ghost Green Core with Damplifier Lite inserts provide lightweight stability with a low swing weight, allowing you to push your limits and send it to the moon.

From the steeps and deeps to the groomed and zoomed, the K2 Passport Snowboard will get you there. On the cover, you get a dependable directional shape, designed for all-mountain freeride fun. And once you start flipping through the pages, you'll find that its backed with K2's top of the line A1 core, triaxial carbon glass, and a super fast sintered 4000 base. It's high end tech in a widely accessible package, ready to be filled with stamps from far flung locales at every snowy corner of the globe.

Sometimes the simplest things are the best, and the Yes. Basic Snowboard is no exception. Coming in with a versatile mid flex and classic CamRock profile, the Basic is a classic twin shape for riders of all stripes.
