This board will satisfy everyone from newbies learning the ropes to veterans tearing it up on the slopes. An easy-going and versatile board, the Basic keeps it simple and fun.

The Salomon Craft Snowboard is a high performance all-mountain board that hits the spot on just about any terrain. With its responsive flex and twin shape, it's perfect for shredding the park or carving up the slopes. The Craft features Salomon's Rock Out Camber profile for a playful yet stable ride, and its medium-soft flex offers a forgiving feel for riders of all levels. Whether you're hitting features or slicing up some courduroy, the Salomon Craft Snowboard is a reliable choice for all your snowboarding adventures.

If the best snowboarder on the mountain is the one having the most fun, we can draw a line under it right now. It's Austen Sweetin, no question. Sweetin is a force of nature - a dynamic, all terrain charger who's down to tackle any line, and usually does so with uncanny style. That's the ethos behind his new pro-model, the Lib Tech Lib Rig Snowboard. Designed for the all-mountain ripper with no boundaries, this do anything, go anywhere shred rig pairs powerful C3 Camber with a little setback and a medium flex for boot-packin', rope-duckin', cliff huckin' good times.

The Nitro Optisym Snowboard is NItro's self-proclaimed "friendly" freestyle board, perfect for those who switch seamlessly between park features and natural side hits, as well as those who love the challenge of the street. Featuring Cam-Out camber for pop without hookiness, a Dual Degressive 2-radius sidecut for predictable turn initiation, and Ureshred Sidewalls and Railkiller Edges for durability, the Optisym simply gets it done, over and over again.

The new Burton Family Tree Gril Master Snowboard is a freestyle masterpiece, blending agility with power for riders who want to be able to have fun cruising mellow runs with the family but also have the gusto to crank up to 11 for a few impromptu runs with the crew. With a responsive flex and a versatile shape, it's ready to slay the side hits, send it off cliffs, and carve up the groomers with style. So start clicking your tongs and strap into the Gril Master and channel your inner Grilo, because legends aren't born, they're carved through experience.

When second place ain't good enough, reach for the Yes. Hel Yes. Snowboard. This powerful freerider is custom made for slashing fresh, straight lining chop, and exploring the unseen, with a Directional CamRock profile and UnderBite edge contouring for grip and control in any terrain. A poplar and paulownia wood core provides stability and power without weighing you down, while bamboo inserts deliver the response required to navigate through the gnarliest of lines. Hell, YES!

Meet the Burton Family Tree Short Stop Snowboard, a new directional powder-slashing masterpiece designed to deliver an exhilarating, surf-like experience on the slopes. Its compact size and generous width make it a nimble and quick deep day companion, while its stiffness and responsiveness (even more so than it's Pow Wrench brethren) add an extra punch of control and high-speed confidence to your ride. Embrace the thrill of carving through untouched powdery terrain with this versatile beast.

If you were headed to a desert island and could only pick one board (this desert island has mountains and a pretty sweet resort), it would have to be the CAPiTA Birds Of A Feather Snowboard. It hits the bullseye for all mountain versatility with a freestyle friendly shape you can take in and out of the park on a whim. Now available in an expanded range of wide sizes for riders with larger boots, there's never been a better time to join the flock.

Situated in the middle of 3-time Freeride World Tour champion Xavier De Le Rue's lineup, the Rossignol XV Sashimi Snowboard is softer than the XV for forgiving playfulness and narrower than the Sushi for maneuverability. Offering the best of both worlds, the Sashimi is the ultimate go-anywhere do anything board. Enhanced with Rossi's RadCut sidecut to deliver quicker, livelier turns and a variety of turn shapes, the XV Sashimi was constructed to blurr the lines between playful, progressive, and full-send.

Where to next? No need to rely on the trail map for your next move - the Burton Cartographer Snowboard has the answers you seek. This pow-friendly all mountain shape is engineered to explore the all the nooks and crannies of your local hill. It comes with a bomber Super Fly® 800G core, powerful Triax™ glass laminates, a stiff, chunder-busting forebody, and a slightly tapered shape to keep that nose up when the going gets deep. Whichever direction you're headed, the Cartographer will help you find the goods.

The Jones Hovercraft 2.0 Snowboard is an updated take on Jones' much loved freeride board, featuring 3D tech and eco-conscious recycled materials. Its floaty nose, compact tail, and directional rocker keep the nimble stability you love from the original with even faster turn initiation and glide thanks to a12mm spoon bevel in the nose and speed-boosting 3D hull in the tail. Available in unisex sizes for riders of every shape and size, the Jones Hovercraft 2.0 Snowboard is an inclusive ripper that busts crud and slashes pow.

Most of our snowboard days aren't in pristine conditions in the backcountry. We're riding variable conditions on chairlifts at resorts. The Yes. Hello Snowboard admits that and plays to it, putting edge hold, carving ability, and all-conditions fun at the forefront of its skills. It'll float in the morning untracked if we're lucky enough to get some, and perform just as well on the last run when everything's tracked out. A directional twin for freestyling all over the hill: that's what this is!

Although they're best known for gnarly freeride boards and featherwight splits, Jones have been quietly honing their freestyle game for years. The Jones Tweaker Snowboard is a recent concoction, a versatile true twin built to perform both in and out of the park. Its unique double radius nose and tail profile is engineered to maximise the running length of the blunted shape, while the V-Core profile hits the sweet spot between playful manueverability and stomping power. If your riding style is built around the idea that everything can be turned into a kicker, you'll feel right at home on the Tweaker.

At heart, snowboarding is about goofing around with your friends and having fun. As the most freestyle-oriented board in the lineup, the Jones Twin Sister Snowboard gets it. It packs a catch-free 3D base, a poppy wood core, and a twin flex pattern for jibby performance both in and out of the park. Next time someone starts droning about dawn patrol missions in the high alpine, reach for the Twin Sister and remind yourself what it's all about.

Very very few of us fit entirely into a single genre of snowboarding. Park, pow, groomers, our riding is really a hybrid of everything out there. The Yes. Hybrid Snowboard mashes two old favorites together with a design that cherry-picks the best technology out there to create something entirely new. Combining the floaty, volume shifted design of the 420 with the grippy Tapered UnderBite outline originally unveiled on the PYL, the Hybrid transcends to a new level of resort versatility. Pow, chunder, groomers, or trees, the Yes. Hybrid Snowboard takes it all in stride.

Let's face it, you don't get cupcakes for the dry, crumbly, cake – it's all about that generous helping of sweet, decadent frosting on top. The GNU Frosting C2 Snowboard brings the same indulgence to all mountain riding, combining a directional shape with a versatile C2 camber profile and an approachable flex. It's the perfect all mountain board for riders gaining confidence and exploring new terrain every time they head to the hill.

If you're after the ultimate jib stick, look no further than the all new Lib Tech Off Ramp Snowboard. Designed and refined by Phil Hansen, Matteo Soltane, and friends, this freestyle machine is perfect for riders stacking clips in the park and the streets alike. Powerful C3 Camber pairs with a true twin shape, Magne-Traction edges, and a poppy Aspen and Paulownia core for a tough, durable board that's begging to be thrashed on your favorite features.

The Bataleon Beyond Medals Snowboard is a nod at the Goliath and Whatever, with a unique elongated nose and squared off tail that supports the fast and aggressive riding style of Tor Lundström. Constructed with a stiff flex and classic directional twin shape, it supports fast and hard riding in whatever conditions you're willing to brave. Sleek graphics and an ultra light core for maneuverability top off this powerful collaboration that combines your favorite brands and riders with functional, shreddable gear.

The Arbor Landmark Camber Splitboard sets the standard for the splitboard makers everywhere: it's an easy-riding board that climbs wonderfully, smashing splitboard barriers before it even sees the snow. A "value" board that'll make even the most experienced splitboarders happy, it boasts a floaty yet powerful shape to tackle any conditions you face. The Knucklehead nose stays afloat in everything, from busy bowls of hot pow chowder to flutes of deep dry chalk. Get this board and take a hike!

When you buy a Jones Mind Expander Snowboard, you must remember to get a new helmet too. To fit all your new ideas, you snow-surfing genius. Blending a directional shape with 3D Contour Base 3.0 and a smooth, camber/rocker profile designed by legendary surf shaper Chris Christenson, this all-mountain slasher exists at the hallowed intersection of burly freeride, creative freestyle, and good old fashioned pow-slashing. Whatever your style, the Mind Expander will have you looking at the mountain from in a whole new light. This season's Mind Expander has seen its inserts moved forward 20mm for a more centered stance option.

Technical riding overload got you down? The Jones Flagship Snowboard is good for what ails ya. Its heady combination of grippy edges, catch free spoony base beveling, and a lively full wood core deliver pure freeriding confidence straight to your feet, without having to bust out the hipflask to steady your nerves. When you wake up to pow, you can rely on the tapered tail and directional rocker to keep you on top, while Float Pack inserts allow you to go mega with a super setback stance for those deepest days. This one's called Flagship for a reason, this board will take your freeride performance to the next level.

Lib Tech isn't playing it subtle - the Lib Tech Lost Quiver Killer C3 Snowboard is your do everything rig and they want you to know it. C3 camber provides stability and pop for freestyle antics and deeeeeeeep carves and the longer nose plows through the pow. Quit agonizing about variable conditions and get the one board to rule them all.
name.en-US: Lib Tech Lost Quiver Killer C3

description.en-US: The Arbor Veda Camber Snowboard is made for riders who seek technical descents, steep bootpacks, and freeride adventures in-bounds and through gates. Thanks to input by legendary rider Marie-France Roy, this board is packed with performance features like 1.5 degree uprise fenders that provide float, edge hold, and turn initiation. Plus a lightweight highland core with durable 360 degree wrapped sidewalls makes the Veda lightweight yet sturdy. Whether you're pushing yourself to go bigger or just embracing your favorite line, the The Arbor Veda Camber Snowboard is a must-have tool in any freerider's gear room.

Taking inspiration from 70s surfboard design, the Arbor Terra Pin Rocker Snowboard is a 3D shaped board that provides seamless edging and a floaty ride in pow. Trading length for volume, this beast is a dream in deep snow thanks to Arbor's System Rocker and Terra Tech Channels in the nose and tail for added float. With a medium flex profile and eco friendly materials, the Terra Pin is poppy and fun, turning good days into great ones.

The GNU Money C2E Snowboard is a park-friendly twin built for ballers on a budget. The G Lite 1 wood core is light and poppy for easy styling around the mountain, and a Banana Tech hybrid rocker profile makes it super easy to smear and press on boxes and rails in the park. If you're trying to get the most possible bang for your buck, it doesn't get much better than the GNU Money C2E Snowboard.

The Cardiff Powgoda Enduro Snowboard is your golden ticket to powder paradise. Whether you're chasing fresh tracks in deep snow or gracefully cruising on groomed runs, this board's got the finesse of a samurai sword and the swagger of a snow ninja. With its HALFcamber™ design and artistic inspiration from Japan's Hōryū-ji pagoda, the Powgoda is your ticket to a legendary ride.

The problem may be unique to the First World, but it weighs heavily on our minds - how to get way up there so you can snowboard down? Jones has the answer in the Jones Solution Splitboard, and they do it arguably better than anyone else. This high performance backcountry tool pulls out all the stops when it comes to features designed to get you up and down in style and comfort - from the "no hook" 3D Contour Base to the Traction Tech 3.0 edge design for better traction on sidehills to the bomber stability derived from the Flax/Basalt Power Stringer layup. Get this Jones split and solve the problem the right way.

The Cardiff Powgoda Enduro Splitboard is that magic all-rounder touring rig that combines nimble handling and progressive style with solid edgehold and the ability to stomp landings with confidence. This is Cardiff's most playful shape, with 50% camber under your bindings and a long rockered nose that eats powder alive. Make your pilgrimage this season to the Powgoda and see what all the worship is about.

The Arbor Veda Splitboard is the ultimate tool for exploring the backcountry. Its lightweight and durable design features a system camber profile for responsiveness in challenging terrain and maneuverability in deep snow. A highland split wood core has paulownia for reduced weight on the uphill, and stability on the down. Plus the sustainably-built construction ensures a better future for our planet. With its versatile and responsive design, the Arbor Veda Splitboard will take your out of bounds riding to a new dimension.

The K2 Medium Snowboard is an ode to the dedicated freestyle fanatic, boasting top-of-the-line technology to deliver the ultimate riding experience. With a twin shape, full camber profile, and Carbon DarkWeb technology, this board provides incredible grip and explosive pop, perfect for tricking off everything in sight. Now available in gender inclusive sizes down to 144cm, this versatile ride is at home in the park, on the groomed, or even in the city.

The Never Summer Proto Synthesis Snowboard sells out nearly every year, and people come back wanting to buy another one a few years later. A following this dedicated doesn't just happen by chance, this board does it all and does it exceedingly well. A Superlight Wood Core backed up by a Recluse Web Carbon Layup at nose and tail make this board light and a breeze to whip around in the park or technical terrain, yet give it plenty of power and pop to energize your riding.

When you buy a Jones Mind Expander Snowboard, you must remember to get a new helmet too. To fit all your new ideas, you snow-surfing genius. Blending a directional shape with 3D Contour Base 3.0 and a smooth, camber/rocker profile designed by legendary surf shaper Chris Christenson, this all-mountain slasher exists at the hallowed intersection of burly freeride, creative freestyle, and good old fashioned pow-slashing. Whatever your style, the Mind Expander will have you looking at the mountain from in a whole new light. Like the Ultra Mind Expander, this season's Mind Expander has seen its inserts moved forward 20mm for more centered stance options.

Inspired by the future, the Nitro Doppleganger Splitboard features the latest and greatest in core technology with its Koroyd® Power Core and Diamond Laminates. Not only does this construction translate to faster, further, and more epic tours, but it also yields a sturdy flex rating (8/10) — which paired with the Cam-Out camber profile — for strong, reliable edgehold across steep alpine faces. If you're serious about splitboarding, level up the experience with the Nitro Doppleganger Splitboard.

The Never Summer Proto Slinger Snowboard looks normal enough, but when the chips are down it comes out firing. Softer flexing and just what the doctor orders for jibby fun all the way down the line, the Proto Slinger uses Shock Wave Rocker Camber and the proven Never Summer Superlight Wood Core and provides excellent soft snow performance as well as a forgiving platform for park progression.

If Michelangelo designed freeride snowboards, his notebook would probably be filled with sketches of the GNU Barrett C3 Snowboard. This board is freeride perfection, with an aggressive C3 profile, directional shape, and firm flex delivering a fast, stable ride and scalpel-like precision. If you're pushing the boundaries in committing terrain, the Barrett has exactly what you need.

The Rossignol Sawblade Snowboard doesn't just barely cut the mustard, it excels at making new tricks as easy to master as your trusty go-tos. A mid-soft flex and AmpTek Auto Turn Rocker make turns intuitive and catch-free, and the Twin Freestyle Flex gives you stiffness between the bindings for pop and power but smooth flexing goodness at the nose and tail for sweet pressability.

Even though you started from the parking lot at your local hill, the promise of Japow is always there. The Weston Japow Splitboard is always on the hunt for deep snow, tight trees, and those hot tubbing monkeys. Explore for more with Weston's great skin attachment system, an easy-touring combo of float and edge hold, and the understated graphics that remind you why you got out of bed so early. Surf is definitely up!

The Ride Kink Snowboard is tough, smooth, and street smart. It's designed to leap rails, gap asphalt, and destroy wall hits as well as snow, making it a great choice for riders stacking clips in the park and then taking it to the urban jungle. A predictable Quadratic Sidecut, overbuilt Cleave Edge™ and Slimewalls® sidewalls for shock absorption are all part of the package, and an expanded size run means even more riders can get in on the act.

You're not the type to go straight down the guy of the most obvious runs. You ride a Weston Backwoods Snowboard, for crying out loud! A freeride board in the shape of a powder chaser, the backwoods excels at all points of your deep snow search. It's very capable through the variable conditions that may show up on your way to the way out, like wind-scoured traverses or icy entrances, getting you to the goods in one piece. And when that secret run opens up into an untracked bowl, the Backwoods goes full-on pow blaster. A fantastic daily driver for deep-snow areas.

The sassy queen of the slopes is back! The Ride Compact Snowboard packs a punch with its soft flex and forgiving feel, making it the perfect partner for shredding all day long. With a playful rocker profile that allows for easy turn initiation while still maintaining a reliable edge and a durable construction that laughs in the face of icy conditions, the Compact is ready to turn heads and carve up the mountain with style. Experience a lifetime of progression in short order with the beginner-intermediate oriented Ride Compact Snowboard.

Standing in line at the resort gives you plenty of time to ponder your situation. What if there was another path, a road less travelled? Well, friend, you're in for a treat. The Rome Uprise Splitboard is built to feed your habit without having to deal with the crowds at the resort. Crafted with Bamboo HotRods and Rome's versatile Free-the-Ride Camber profile, this split offers handles the skin track with ease and slays when you point it down. Problem solved.

The K2 Manifest Snowboard is the perfect tool for turning your snowboarding dreams into reality. Whether you're an all-mountain rider, park rat, or a sidecountry ninja, this directional twin has you covered. Backed by K2's top-of-the-line technology, the Manifest boasts a snappy A1 Core and Carbon DarkWeb™ for pop and precision, while the directional cambered shape and fast Sintered 4000 Base make it equally adept on groomers and powder alike. Don't miss your chance to manifest your destiny with this versatile and capable deck!

Everyone knows the after parties are for the VIPs, and the Rossignol After Hours Snowboard will make sure your name is always on the list. The AmpTek Elite rocker-camber profile is stable with just the right amount of forgiveness and the L.I.T.E. Grip tech gives you extra edge control so you can send it harder and hang with the pros.

The Never Summer Proto Slinger Snowboard is a soft-flexing twin for the most technical of park riders, with a buttery smooth personality and tons of pop and poise. Featuring the NS Superlight Wood Core and classic Shockwave RC profile for the best in high-flying durability, and a fresh topsheet that brings to mind the psychedelic '60s.

The CAPiTA Pathfinder Reverse Camber Snowboard illuminates the way for freestyle dreamers and resort riders who know what they want: light weight, durability, and tons of trusted tech for a reasonable financial outlay. This model features a rocker-flat-rocker profile with a softer flex, taking the sting out of hardpack for intermediate riders (and keeping everything mellow for experienced rippers). With a predictable wood core, fast base, and tough construction, this is a workhorse of a playboard for jump jockeys and fun-focused folks.

The CAPiTA Navigator Snowboard builds on its excellent debut with a few tweaks. This board excels in sniffing out chairlift-accessed pow, and thanks to a new core and camber profile, it's even better at its job. Its Resort V2 Directional profile hits the groomers with the hold of traditional camber and elevated contact points let you annihilate deep snow. Set a few waypoints and head out towards the secret stashes on a true all-mountain freestyle shape, light and smooth and ready to rip.

The CAPiTA Micro Mini Snowboard is the MVP when it comes to young riders taking their first steps in snowboarding. This redesigned series boasts an improved shape and sidecut, making it easier than ever for kids as young as 2 years old (80) to 8 years old (110) to learn and progress confidently. With board lengths matching the distance from floor to chin or brow, these boards are tailor-made for a smooth and exciting introduction to the snowy slopes.

Now available with an expanded size offering, the CAPiTA Jess Kimura Mini Snowboard offers a versatile, youth-friendly design that bridges the gap between the Micro Mini and mainline women's boards. Crafted with eco-conscious practices at The Mothership, it boasts reforestation-certified sustainable woodcores and cutting-edge technology, all at a budget-friendly price point for parents. With iconic graphics from Jess Kimura's pro model history and the inspiration of a snowboarding legend, this board empowers young riders, propelling their progression on the slopes.

Get ready to dominate the slopes with the Nidecker Score Snowboard! This board is the perfect combination of all mountain style and performance for beginner to intermediate riders, featuring a directional shape, camber profile, and a mid-soft, responsive flex. With its premium construction and innovative design, the Score will help you level up your riding game. Don't settle for less, score big with Nidecker!

Espresso and steamed milk. Smooth and energetic, mellow yet focused! The Lib Tech Cortado C2 Snowboard is all that and then some, like its namesake caffeinated bean drink. This is a board for swooper troopers, for the foam fam. It has enough taper and setback to be a directional board, but not so much that it's banned from the park. The Cortado is light, poppy, and pretty much fun all over, making it a board you'll grab on pow and park days alike.

It doesn't take much, but when you've committed to life standing sideways there's a freedom that comes the decision. Full dedication to the boardriding nation, and you're ready to double up. The Yes. All-In Snowboard is the perfect opening move, easy enough to cover while leaving you with tons of options. This is a directional twin all-mountain freestyle board, the kind of board that'll transition easily from park to pow without any glaring deficits. Push your chips to the center and leave the decisions to the other guys: you made the right move!

The CAPiTA Spring Break Powder Racer Snowboard is the stick to have when the race is on for powder, for sure. Plenty of surface area and a light Hover Core™ mean max float and snappy maneuverability in the trees, plus the Surf Camber gets you up on top in a flash. It's not just for pow, though, as the SB Powder Racer smokes groomers as well, leaving you with no bad choices when this board is your quiver of one.

For an even freer style, CAPiTA took one of their most iconic shapes, the tip'n'tail of the Ultrafear, and bent it the other way. The CAPiTA Ultrafear Reverse Camber Snowboard makes for quicker transitions, deeper presses, and a bit more float than its traditionally-cambered predecessor. This is a board for park, rails, and interstellar cheese wedges, an all-out freestyle dominator. With the perfect amount of flex, the Ultrafear Reverse Camber is set up for extra pop into iffy landings, its rockered contact points staying catch-free for longer in those iffy landings. Harness that fear and launch!

Some things are inevitable. Night will follow day, fearsome empires will become victims of their own hubris and fall into decline, and your kid will one day be a better snowboarder than you. The best you can do is help them along the way, and there's no better tool than the CAPiTA Scott Stevens Mini Snowboard. With a soft, poppy flex and a low maintenance extruded base, this one is built tough and custom made for kids honing their skills both in and out of the park.

Be freeride ready on the Jones Ultra Flagship Snowboard. It has a lot of everything: a stiff flex, a powerful core, and supreme stability in variable snow. The Ultra Flagship's tapered shape adds float in deep snow, and a core made with bamboo stringers provides incredible torsional strength. Add even more speed with an Ultra base, which is fast and durable all over the mountain. Get ready to tear up the competition on the Jones Ultra Flagship Snowboard.

Apparently it's silent in a glider. You get pulled up into the clouds on a string, and when your tow plane leaves it takes the sounds with it, leaving only calm silence. Cool. The Lib Tech Glider BTX Snowboard can get you soaring like that too, thanks to a softer flex and Lib's classic Original Banana profile. The Glider will have you tracing smooth arcs across mellow meadows, sending frozen dandelion seeds of snow floating in your silent wake. It's also capable of some slo-mo airtime vibes too, if you're looking for park-based freestyling (and a more on-the-nose analogy). Glide on!

The kids are better than all right: the kids are absolutely ripping! Across the snowy lands, groms are growing their snow skills beyond the scope of what's been believable in the past. There's a problem, though: the only boards that fit them are progression minded kids' boards with soft flex profiles and low-end tech. Rising up to right the wrongs, the Lib Tech T.Ripper C2 Snowboard is a smaller version of the full size T-Rice that offers the same world conquering top end for shredders who can't yet fit the adult sizes. Soon to be seen on a junior freeride comp podium at a mountain near you.

Walking the plank never felt so good. The Rome Gang Plank Snowboard puts it all together so you can get it together on the hill - a fully twinned shape, medium flex, and a forgiving Rocker-Flat-Rocker profile that lets you get away with the occasional underspun trick - with Bamboo Omega HotRods for pop and Flax Impact Plates to take the sting out of hard landings.

Designed for the hard charger who doesn't take bad snow for an answer, the Rossignol Revenant Snowboard shreds well in all conditions and all terrain, and lets you throw in your best tricks along the way. Creative riders will appreciate the Twin Freestyle shape, and the extra power Rossi gets by adding Ariamid and Carbon fiber to the layup.

Like an artist in ancient Greece, the creative snowboarder in our times is nothing without her muse. Get on the Rome Muse Snowboard and make sure you're covered when it comes to creating your own style, flow and rhythm; this directional twin has pop and pressability to spare but is still plenty forgiving when you don't quite stick it.

A new high octane freestyle board from Rome that'll put newfound power in your routine, the Rome Rene-Gade Snowboard features Carbon Omega Hotrods and a stiff flex, along with tons of camber for even more hops. Not for the faint of heart, the Rene-Gade is for the rider who's got their moves dialed and wants to crank the volume to 11.

Built to make mincemeat of the biggest and steepest lines on your list, the Salomon Highpath Snowboard uses a mid-stiff directional shape and Salomon's best materials to deliver a ride that's calm and collected in the burliest of terrain and deepest of snowpacks yet still turns on a dime when the line demands it. Full FSC® Certified Aspen cores with Popster CNC'd profiles provide strength and energy, while the addition of C/FX Carbon/Basalt weave creates a smooth and confident ride without excess weight. A high-end tool for the rider who thrives on challenge.

A super versatile all-mountain board that doesn't require a huge commitment in the gym to get max performance, the Salomon Bliss Snowboard handles a wide range of big mountain conditions with grace and ease. Powered by an Aspen Strong core with Popster profiling for extra energy between turns and a tapered directional shape that finishes the turn without hanging up at the wrong time, Salomon's Bliss will make your bliss that much easier to attain.

The Bataleon Distortia Snowboard is a lightweight womens twin for freestyle progression and all mountain prowess. Its symmetrical shape, twin flex, and updated 3D base profile make switch riding, spins, and buttering a breeze. Trusted by Annika Morgan and Klaudia Medlova, this board will help you ride like the pros. Get your stoke on with an all-new shape and trippy graphics.

The Bataleon Spirit Snowboard is built to help you progress and keep the stoke flowing as your skills grow. As the softest, friendliest board in the Bataleon lineup, this deck is a blast to ride and easy to get the hang of. You've caught the bug, now master the art with the Bataleon Spirit Snowboard.

A strong directional design with the camber stacked under the rear foot, the Salomon Bellevue Snowboard lays down clean and precise turns on demand and excels on hard snow but still loves a pow day. Sound like it's too good to be true? Snag a test ride and you'll be a believer, there are no bad days on the Bellevue.

Live, laugh, and love on the Lib Tech No. 43 C2X Snowboard. This advanced, freestyle monster is made for the shralpiest women on the mountain who don't know how to stay on the ground. Jibs, rails, blasting off for air time - whatever and wherever you're feeling, the No.43 will get you there with maximum style and stoke.

Nothing kills it in the park and pipe like the Nitro T1, and this special edition Fabien Fuchs is the icing on the cake for freestyle riders worldwide. Built around the Powercore II wood core with a full twin shape and Cam-Out Camber profile for maximum power and pop, the Nitro T1 X FFF Snowboard is what you want underfoot when you're laying down lap after lap in the park and going for greatness.

The Nitro Mystique Snowboard is an easy-going frontside board designed to progress as fast as you're ready, with a forgiving gullwing Rocker profile (reverse camber between the bindings) and a directional twin shape that lets you ride both ways with equal confidence. Built around a Poplar and Beech wood core with an extruded FH Base for durability, the Mystique takes the uncertainty out of improving your riding.

When the snow gets sketchy or the weather is weird, it's time to pull out your Yes. Dicey Snowboard and hit the features. Made with a predictable flex and catch-free shape, this true twin provides a forgiving ride to every aspiring park rat and to intermediate tricksters looking to progress their skills quickly. Take some variables out of the equation and get down to riding!

The Rome Heist Snowboard gets a new shape, slightly stiffer flex, and a faster base to further distinguish it from the new Hype, and you're the beneficiary. This year's Heist is snappier and more powerful without giving up the balanced all-mountain ride you love. The Fusion Camber with a small amount of Double Kick rocker at both ends stays the same, the board gets extra snap from Bamboo Omega HotRods and extra glide from a new SinterStrong sintered base.

The Nidecker Escape Snowboard is a mechanism for getting away from the crowds, whether it be ducking out the backcountry gate or hiking to that pristine line you've been eyeing for months. With a full directional shape and plenty of nose rocker, the Escape not only provides great hold on firm snow but floats like a boat in pow - just the combination for your most worthy off-piste adventures.

Like a best friend that's always down to explore wherever your heart takes you, the Nitro Lectra Snowboard is a reliable all-mountain machine. With a forgiving flex and easily maneuverable Flat-Out rocker profile, this traditionally shaped snowboard will give you the confidence to take on the bumps, the nimbleness to venture through the trees, and the stability to carve it up on the groomers.

The Salomon HPS - Taka 2.0 Splitboard is designed for speedy uphill travel without sacrificing on the descent. The reduced profile makes it Salomon's lightest, most buoyant shape, achieved by utilizing the Ghost Green Core and Damplifier Lite honeycomb inserts. The large rockered nose and tapered directional shape floats and pivots with ease in deep snow and it comes with custom-cut, cult-favorite Pomoca Skins and Plum hardware. The base is 100% recycled too, so the board is lighter on your feet and on the planet.

The Arbor Landmark Rocker Splitboard sets the standard for the splitboard makers everywhere: it's an easy-riding board that climbs wonderfully, smashing splitboard barriers before it even sees the snow. A "value" board that'll make even the most experienced splitboarders happy, it boasts a floaty yet powerful shape to tackle any conditions you face. The Knucklehead nose stays afloat in everything, from busy bowls of hot pow chowder to flutes of deep dry chalk. Get this board and take a hike!

A standout in the fast and light crowd, the Nitro Vertical Splitboard is the ultimate high-alpine machine. Impossibly light thanks to its exclusive Koroyd® Powerlite core, this board will practically float you up mountains while the stiff flex and True Camber rocker profile ensure reliable edgehold across steep angle slopes and less-than-ideal snow conditions. Complete with quick and easy Nitro x Kohla skin attachment points, the Nitro Vertical Splitboard is ready to bag tour after tour. Are your legs ready?

If floppy, tepid beginner boards are holding your little ripper back, it's time to put them on one that can hang with the bigger riders. The Jones Flagship Snowboard offers the same high-octane freeride performance as the full size version, with directional rocker and 3D Base Contour 1.0 shaping surfy turns in the deep and Traction Tech 3.0 edges for locking into carves and hanging on in optimistic situations. When their equipment is up to the task, there's no stopping their progression.

Tailored to pro rider Bryan Iguchi's humility mindset and gnarly uphill approach, the Arbor Satori Camber Splitboard has a deep sidecut for reactive grip climbing and fast edge to edge turning when you're groovin' downhill. Constructed with Arbor's signature System Camber Technology and Uprise Fenders, the Satori is solid, approachable, and made to make you feel alive. Get out on the skin track in any condition imaginable, the Arbor Satori Camber Splitboard is made to handle it all and make you feel amazing while doing it.

The Arbor Coda Rocker Splitboard brings the legendary versatility and performance of the Coda to the backcountry. Based on a design that's earned renown for its ability to handle varied conditions with ease, this split guarantees confidence in whatever you find beyond the resort boundaries. Arbor's System Rocker profile is easy to turn in challenging snow and excellent in soft snow, the lightweight construction ideal for flying up the skin track and down your favorite line.

If you like early morning missions or catching sunset on the skin track, the Rossignol After Hours Splitboard will get you up and down the mountain with ease. The lightweight wood core and short sidecut radius are made for fast climbs and nimble descents, whether you're slashing through pow fields or cutting through the trees. The AmpTek Elite profile features camber underfoot for stability and snap and a little rocker at the tips for a catch free ride that riders of every level will enjoy.

Get the Nidecker Elle Snowboard, and get on with the business of dialing in those riding skills. A forgiving and versatile shape that will let you explore your limits without those nasty "hooking" incidents, the Elle is a perfect first board for those progressing beyond the rental game, as well as a great learning board for intermediate riders.

Mold their minds when they're most malleable. Teach the impressionable youth about roasting pow turns with the Jones Mini Mind Expander Snowboard. This board will take their riding beyond left-right-left on groomers to the hallowed temple of deep snow stoke. There's no rear-leg burn, no over-the-bars tumbles, no sluggish reactions here: this board is a deep snow tool that'll get them even more hyped on snowboarding. It's contagious, too. This is what it's all about!

The Arbor Swoon is exactly the type of board you want your split to be based on - powerful, precise, reliable, and well-rounded. The Arbor Swoon Camber Splitboard has an intuitive and dependable feel that you will immediately trust on lines that push your comfort levels, whether that means opening up the throttle on high speed runouts, or dancing down narrow, technical chutes. It's lightweight on the skin track, grippy in spicy terrain, and energetic and floaty on mellow powder laps.

Whether you're getting deep in the backcountry for untracked lines or enjoying your time in nature, it all ties back to a healthy planet. The Salomon Highpath Splitboard features recycled and sustainable materials, including the base, topsheet, resins, and edges. Don't think it comes at a performance cost, either - the tapered directional shape and Rock Out Camber are stable and quick in variable terrain. The kit comes with Plum Hardware and pre-cut, cult-favorite Pomoca Skins too, so it's truly the ultimate package.

The Arbor Coda Camber Splitboard brings the legendary versatility and performance of the Coda to the backcountry. Based on a design that's earned renown for its ability to handle varied conditions with ease, this split guarantees confidence in whatever you find beyond the resort boundaries. Arbor's System Camber profile provides grip and stability for firm snow and technical terrain, and the snappy, lightweight construction allows for a fun and playful ride when the conditions are ripe.

Sure, you could take a chainsaw to your old beater board and make your own splitty, or you could skip all that and pick up the Burton Flight Attendant Splitboard so you can have fun right away. Its directional camber profile has rocker in the nose to help you surf the soft stuff with camber behind it to let you load up power and have reliable control on the descent. Triax™ glass and carbon reinforcement gives the Burton Flight Attendant Splitboard the torsional rigidity and lightness combo that splitboarders crave and appreciate, going both up and down.

Rocker around! The Arbor Crosscut Rocker Snowboard inspires confidence everywhere from smooth in-bounds groomers to fluffy off-piste pow. Equipped with a directional shape, mild taper, and setback stance, cruising in style never looked so dreamy. Cut with carving in mind, the Crosscut's wide turning radius helps you look GOOD every time you turn. Bold, bright art and eco friendly materials round out the Arbor Crosscut Rocker Snowboard. This is one you won't want to miss.

For the tweener with skillzz who's outgrown those cutsey kids boards and beats you down the hill, the Yes. First Basic Snowboard is the perfect foray into equipment with oomph. Constructed with Yes's signature design and an easy to maneuver flat rocker profile, the First Basic certainly won't be their last.

Introducing the Roxy Raina LTD Snowboard, the ultimate shred companion for snow royalty. With a medium-soft flex, this board is your ticket to playful snowboarding bliss. Its directional twin geometry, Magne-Traction®, and C2 contour ensure you'll dominate any snow condition with comfort and precision, and a limited edition evo exclusive topsheet means you'll turn heads in the lift line too. Whether you're a beginner ready to level up or an entry-level rider seeking a progression boost, the Roxy Raina LTD Snowboard is your next go-to.

The Never Summer Proto Slinger X Snowboard looks normal enough, but when the chips are down it comes out firing. Softer flexing and just what the doctor orders for jibby fun all the way down the line, the Proto Slinger X uses Shock Wave Rocker Camber and the proven Never Summer Superlight Wood Core and provides excellent soft snow performance as well as a forgiving platform for park progression.

The Rossignol Meraki Snowboard is designed to shred the park as hard as you do, and still offer a stable and precise ride all over the mountain when you just want to chill and make some turns. A dual-radius RadCut sidecut along with 3S serrated edges delivers a balance between edgehold and forgiveness, and an ultra fast 4000 series sintered base keeps you moving at all times.

The Rossignol Diva Snowboard is is ready to belt it out and let the chips fall where they may, hitting all the high notes with ease and letting you bask in the applause. Stiff, powerful and versatile to a fault, the Diva performs at the highest level so you can, too.

Maybe you don't have the same freeride background as Xavier de le Rue - not many do - but if your most fervent desire is to rip big mountain terrain where no lift exists, the Rossignol XV Split Splitboard is the tool for the job. With a special flex pattern that gives you power under the front foot in questionable terrain and the ability to wash the tail when you need to scrub speed in hurry, a high tech THC core and Aramid and Basalt to lend strength and calm the chatter, the XV Split is a backcountry powerhouse you won't want to leave the trailhead without.

With its soft-flexing, flat cambered twin design and catchy Volcom topsheet (just like the big guys!), the Nitro Ripper X Volcom Snowboard offers an easier learning experience with less body slams and simply more fun for the little set than anything else under the sun.

Get ready to fall head over heels for the Roxy XOXO C3 Snowboard. This freestyle favorite has been turning heads for years, and it's only getting better. The C2 contour combines camber and rocker, delivering the ultimate all-terrain fun. With its snappy flex and just the right amount of power, this board is a park-prowess powerhouse. Whether you're conquering the park or exploring the whole mountain, the XOXO brings love and confidence to your ride. Say hello to your new freestyle bff.

When Lib Tech sets out to go retro, things can get a little confusing. Way ahead of the game for decades, any attempt to go back in time can look like a quantum leap forward with these guys...behold the Lib Tech Steely D C3 Snowboard, their new floaty cambered deep snow spooner. This baby comes in one size, 167cm, so there's no question about its aims: this is a board made for high speeds. In deep snow, the spoon nose helps achieve this with unreal float and easy turn initiation. On hardpack, the Magne-Traction and progressive sidecut take over. Everything old is new again, especially with Lib Tech. Looking forward to the future-ready past! Whooooooooosh.

Step into snowboarding history with the Bataleon 20Y Snowboard. This limited edition Goliath commemorates 20 years of innovation and style in a mid-flexing all mountain package. The topsheet showcases 400 iconic graphics from the past, while the base features another 400 eye-catching base graphics. Own a piece of Bataleon history and grab a copy of the 20Y anniversary book at your local shop, and complete the on-hill look with the Bataleon 20Y Snowboard Bindings.

The Nitro Drop Snowboard is an all-mountain ride that gets it done under any circumstances. With a smooth riding Cam-Out profile that blends tons of pop with easy handling and intuitive turn initiation, the Drop makes you riding come alive. Powerlite Core, a super fast Sintered Speed Formula HD base, and Nitro's classic directional twin shape round out the package.

The Rome Party Mod Snowboard isn't about to let you have a bad time, no matter the occasion. It's high-proof construction, with Carbon HotRods and Flax Impact Plates galore, is all about launching you that much harder and insulating your feet from the shock of flat, hard landings, while the true twin shape is ready to get loose any direction you happen to be travelling.

Name notwithstanding, this is one fish that's forever fresh the moment the snow gets deep - the Rome Stalefish Snowboard is Ståle Sandbech's pick for whenever the going gets steep and deep, with equal chops in steep techy terrain and bottomless pow. Damp, smooth, and with tons of power, the Stalefish is the catch of the day for big mountain fun.

A hard charging freeride tool meant for the discerning rider, the WNDR Alpine BelleAire Snowboard thrives in deeper snowpacks but doesn't leave you stranded on a groomer day when it hasn't snowed in two weeks. Featuring the full complement of WNDR algal technologies and materials, the BellAire uses an Aspen wood and Algal Polyurethane foam core, poured Algal PU sidewalls, and an insert plate made of ground up production waste from the factory held in suspension with Bio Beans™ Resin. Feel good about the way your board rips in all conditons and good about the fact that it was made with a conscience at the same time.

A new big mountain shape from designer Nick Russell, with the gnarliest lines you can reach without skinning to them in mind, the WNDR Alpine Shepherd Snowboard pairs a pairs a tight radius sidecut with 18mm of taper for a ride you can trust your life on in steep and technical terrain. Built with a conscience and the most innovative technology in the sport in Salt Lake City, the choice of materials relies on locally sourced wood and algea-based components whenever possible but doesn't sacrifice the ride or durability.

The Public Snowboards General Snowboard has the overall good of society in mind. This is a board that understands the universal appeal of snow sliding, making sure nobody is left behind as it rips around the mountain. It comes in a size for anyone (with a new 160W!) and handles all terrain with equal levels of stoke, an easy-riding team favorite that doubles as a great beginner's board. Hybrid Alert camber gives you enough rocker to surf powder and plenty of grip for control and stability in chopped out terrain. In short, the Public Snowboards General Snowboard generally snowboards very well. And snowboarding is what life is all about!

The Bataleon Evil Twin+ Snowboard is so powerful, it must have eaten its siblings in the womb and absorbed their abilities. An iconic board for an iconic company, this version of the suped up freestyle twin features an updated ultralight core, super fast base, and a new outline shape that makes it more powerful than ever. Complete with a medium flex and Sidekick tech, turning into the jump line just got even better.

We know there are no friends on a powder day, but that rule doesn't quite apply to family. Help your kiddos keep up with you after a big dump with the Bataleon Surfer Mini Snowboard. The long swallowtail and giant nose will keep them floating and the soft flex is easy for smaller riders to control. Bataleon's standard 3BT™ uplifted sidebases adds some extra buoyancy and smooth turn initiation so they'll still be ripping laps when your old legs give out.

The Lib Tech Split BRD Splitboard is designed for fun on both sides of the skin track. The lightweight Paulownia core and Karakoram Ultra Clips help you fly up the hill and breeze through transitions, and then it's all about that sweet BRD shape for the way down. This directional board is fast and floaty, perfect for dreamy powder descents. Plus, it has a C3 camber profile for the perfect blend of edge hold on dicey conditions and playful pop when it's time to send that windlip or backcountry booter.
